Arthur confesses his love for Mera once again, again proposing they get married, but Mera is hesitant with all the drama they've endured. However, she then reveals she's pregnant.
Arthur affirms that he loves both Mera and their unborn child but, afraid that he won't be able to give his child the life it deserves, asks to go home and think. Mera, unhappy that she and her love don't seem to be on the same page, loses control, "kills" Arthur, and is later found by the Widowhood and Atlantean guards. [ 144 ]
The Birth of Princess Andy
As Mera's pregnancy progressed, Arthur returned to life and Amnesty Bay, however, he did not go to Mera nor she to him. Arthur's nemesis Black Manta destroyed an ancient Atlantean historical site to draw Mera to the surface, where she and Aquaman met and wordlessly reconciled. Manta attacked the pair with Mecha Manta, provided by Lex Luthor. Mera destroyed Mecha Manta but the huge amounts of hydrokinetic power she was forced to use put her in a coma. She was rushed to an Atlantean hospital and gave birth shortly afterwards to a baby girl, who was named Andrina, or "Andy" for short. Arthur was present for his daughter's birth, and fell in love with her instantly, losing all of his trepidation about becoming a father or the kind of life they could have together. [ 149 ] Andy spent the first ten months of her life being raised in Amnesty Bay by her father and his extended group of friends and allies. She and Arthur would regularly sneak into Atlantis to visit the still-comatose Mera in secret. [ 150 ]
The Wedding of Arthur and Mera
The Aquaman and Mera Wedding
Mera reawakens after 10 months in a coma. With the ruse of a fake wedding to Vulko she calls to Atlantis the leaders of the 7 underwater kingdoms. Prior to the wedding, she has the entire widowhood arrested. Once all 7 kingdoms are assembled, to their surprise, Mera announces that she was dissolving the Atlantean monarchy and that she intended to hand power to the people. [ 151 ] Orm attempts to take power for himself, however, Orm and his forces are stopped by Aquaman, assisted by the Justice league and the Sea gods.
Following this Arthur and Mera settle down in Amnesty Bay with their daughter Andy. Soon afterwards Mera and Arthur marry in the presence of their family and friends, in what was originally planned as a surprise welcome back party for her by Arthur. [ 152 ]
Endless Winter
Following the abolition of the monarchy, Arthur and Mera intended to hold themselves apart from Atlantis to allow the city to govern itself, but they were forced to intervene when the Frost King's forces attacked the city during what was intended to be their honeymoon. The pair with Andy in tow, go to Atlantis and discuss with the Atlantean ruling council with is to be done to save the city. Arthur journeyed into the city's heating vents to meet with the Fire Tolls who lived in the tunnels below Atlantis, hoping they could be an ally against the Frost King. Originally Mera agreed to stay behind to guard Andy but quickly followed him, arriving in time to save Arthur from a Fire Troll with a hydrokinetic attack. The Trolls were in awe of this and swore loyalty to her. With her army of Fire Trolls, Mera and Arthur defeated the ice creatures attacking Atlantis. [ 153 ]
Death Metal
This section of the article does not provide a complete profile of the subject. You can help out by providing additional information, expanding on the subject matter in order to bring this article to a higher standard of quality.
Infinite Frontier
Warworld Rising
A ramshackle ship of refugees from Warworld fled to Earth, pursued by alien fighter craft called Warzoons. [ 154 ] Superman and Superboy rescued the refugees and destroyed some of the Warzoons, while the others fled. The Atlantean army captured and imprisoned the crews of the Warzoons and took custody of the refugee ship, which was powered by a mysterious piece of rock, known as the Genesis Fragment. Although Arthur was no longer king he was able to convince the Atlantean authorities to allow Superman to inspect the wreckage and try to interrogate the prisoners, although they did so only out of respect to Arthur and refused to let Superman take the power source or inform the surface governments that they had it. [ 155 ]
Aquaman & Superman battle Maric
Maric, the Atlantean scientist assigned to study the power source, mutated into a gigantic monster and attacked the Florida coastline alongside strange sea creatures which were immune to Arthur's telepathy. Arthur and some Atlantean soldiers tried to fight off the monsters but were overwhelmed, so he called the Justice League for help. Superman was able to freeze the giant from inside and the Atlanteans drove the other creatures back.
However, victory was short lived as Steve Trevor arrived and demanded that Atlantis hand the fragment over the the US Government. Arthur refused, telling Trevor that any attempt to take the fragment would be viewed as an act of war. [ 156 ] A pair of Task Force X agents working for Amanda Waller snuck into the crashed ship and attempted to steal the Genesis Fragment, but were caught by the Atlantean army. In response, the Atlanteans blockaded all shipping lanes across the Atlantic Ocean.
The Justice League met to try to find a solution, but were unable to come to an agreement. Both Arthur and Batman were uncharacteristically belligerent and began arguing almost immediately, each taking the sides of their respective countries. Batman demanded that Arthur convince the Atlanteans to give up the Fragment, and Arthur replied that he could and would not do so. Arthur almost stormed out of the meeting when Batman accused Atlantis of starting an arms race, but Superman shut their fight down, saying he would not allow a war between Atlantis and the surface. [ 157 ]
Arthur believed that Batman may attempt to take the Fragment and stood guard over the crashed Warzoon. Meanwhile the United States Navy sent a battleship to break the Atlantean blockade and despite Superman's attempts to negotiate a peaceful solution the two sides fired on each other. Superman decided that the only way to prevent them going to war over the Fragment would be to take it beyond both their reach and dove down to the Warzoon where Arthur confronted him. He admitted that he could not stop Superman but warned him that it would change things between them. Despite this, Superman took the Fragment. [ 158 ]
Deep Target
"Aquaman" and "Green Arrow"
Atlanteans from the distant past began mysteriously appearing inside the city. Arthur swore to find out what had happened and help them return to their own time. Atlantean scientists discovered a distinctive tachyon signature where the strangers had appeared, and Arthur searched the Justice League files for similar readings, matching them to emissions detected from a small building in Star City . Arthur broke into the building and found himself in a seemingly infinite hallway. He met his teammate Green Arrow in the hallway as they fought off henchmen, and they realized that the infinite hallway was an illusion. Arthur stole a pair of goggles from a henchman which allowed him to see the building as it truly was. He spotted a door and the two went through it, finding a laboratory seemingly with a group of hostages bound in the center. Oliver rushed over to save them but Arthur could not hear the hostages and realized they were an illusion. When Oliver reached the hostages the hologram deactivated, revealing that they were standing on a high-tech platform. Arthur tried to tackle Oliver off the platform, while at the same time he shot out the platform's main projector. It was in fact a time travel platform developed by Scorpio , and the resulting accident caused the two men to switch lives and histories. [ 159 ]
Arthur awoke to find that he had lost his powers and was recognized by everyone as "Arthur Queen," the head of Queen Industries . He also had a secret identity as the vigilante Green Arrow with the archery and gadgetry skills to match. He deduced that Oliver must now be living his life and mistakenly believed that Ollie had intentionally stolen his powers. Using his intimate knowledge of his own weaknesses he developed trick arrows to exploit them and allow him to fight his much stronger opponent. He infiltrated Atlantis and attacked Oliver in the throne room, but was eventually overpowered. Oliver convinced Arthur that he was not responsible for what happened to them and the two teamed up to find out why they had switched lives. [ 2 ] They planned to go to S.T.A.R. Labs in Arthur's jet, but one of the pilots was a Scorpio agent who redirected them to a remote island where they were attacked by General Anderton , the leader of Scorpio's time travel project. [ 160 ] Anderton overpowered them and took them to Scorpio's base on the moon where he tortured them for information, trying to determine exactly how the accident had occurred. During the interrogation, Arthur realistically faked his death using a technique Oliver had learned in Nanda Parbat and which he now remembered. When Scorpio medics untied him to check him over, he escaped and freed Oliver. They fought their way out, only to find that the facility was on the moon. [ 159 ]
The two fought their way to the base's hanger and stole a rocket to escape back to Earth. Scorpio satellites fired on the rocket and forced them to crash-land in the Atlantic Ocean. Arthur almost drowned and passed out, but Oliver was able to save him and take them to Amnesty Bay. When Arthur woke up he found that the town was now inhabited by humanoid dinosaurs who attacked them, but they were rescued by General Anderton. [ 161 ] Anderton explained that when they escaped he had activated the "Tabula Rasa protocol," whereby Scorpio operatives would be sent into the prehistoric past to allow Scorpio to control history from the very beginning. Safeguards intended to ensure that operatives landed safely failed and many were killed instantly, the few survivors were fused with dinosaurs in the same way General Anderton was. This altered the timeline to such an extent that dinosaurs survived into the 21st Century and sentient, humanoid dinosaurs were Earth's dominant life form. As Anderton, Oliver and Arthur had previously been through the time platforms, they were unaffected by the changes to the timeline.
Anderton believed they could return to the original timeline by travelling back to the earliest point in time Scorpio had ever visited, marked by a device called a "time stamp," before any of the operatives arrived, and from there jump into the beam of Scorpio's first ever time travel experiment. The three of them constructed a working time machine and returned to the original timeline at a point two years in the past. As a side effect, Arthur became Aquaman again. [ 162 ] They destroyed Scorpio's prototype time machine and captured the Scorpio technicians and both versions of General Anderton.
Although it seemed like everything was back to normal, Arthur and Oliver could sense that subtle changes had been made to the timeline, which was confirmed when Arthur sensed a liopleurodon in a nearby lake. Oliver asked Arthur to check his memories for anomalies, and when he did he realized that in this new timeline Atlanna was in Atlantis and he and Orm were still friends and ruled Atlantis together. Arthur told Oliver that everything was the way it should be and he needed to get back to Atlantis. Arthur was slightly suspicious but not worried, and agreed they should both go home to recuperate, giving Arthur a communicator so they could stay in touch. Arthur discarded the communicator after they split and returned to Atlantis, cutting off all contact with the surface.
Eight days later Oliver attacked the Atlantean Royal Palace , demanding Arthur come out. [ 163 ] He was captured by the Atlantean Guard and imprisoned in The Aquarium, Atlantis' maximum security prison. Arthur visited Oliver in prison and apologized, but told him that he could not give up this new reality, even when Oliver told him that the younger version of General Anderton had escaped from prison and killed all the other incarcerated Scorpio agents. However, he reluctantly agreed when Oliver  told him that the changes to the timeline had made the lives of many other worse, for example, in this timeline Alex Santos was not simply killed on a building site but fell asleep at the wheel and accidentally drove off the freeway, killing both himself and two of his children.
Arthur said goodbye to Atlanna and he and Oliver headed for the moon in a spaceship flown by the older General Anderton, who had turned on Scorpio when they tried to kill him to tie up loose ends. When they reached the moonbase they were attacked by the younger General Anderton, who had been given super-strength by drugs. Arthur fought the other Anderton while Arrow and the future version of Anderton went to the time travel laboratory. They built "time bands" to protect themselves from changes to the timeline and then Anderton once again travelled to the earliest point Scorpio had ever visited, planning to deactivate the time stamp network to prevent Scorpio ever developing time travel.
The younger Anderton tried to kill them by deactivating the base's shielding and sending them into space, but Oliver was able to shoot the time band towards Arthur with an arrow just in time. The timeline returned to normal and they found themselves back in the Scorpio laboratory in Star City, having just jumped off the time platform. They went back to Atlantis and visited Atlanna's memorial. [ 164 ]
Aquamen
Although Arthur had claimed that all his memories had returned after his resurrection, many gaps remained. Eventually he remembered the sleeper agents that General Mako had placed on the surface all those years ago and began searching for them, claiming he was going to Mars on a mission with Frankenstein . [ 13 ]
While Arthur was searching for the sleepers he left Jackson Hyde in charge during his absence. [ 165 ] When he returned he learned that Jackson had been accused of launching a terrorist attack inside Atlantis and was on the run. However, before Arthur could deal with that the Atlantean Council was attacked by a new villain called Devil Ray , who had developed a poison fatal to Atlanteans but harmless to humans. Arthur deduced that the attack on the council was merely a test for a larger one against the entire city and tasked the Drift to search the city for poison bombs. [ 166 ] They were only able to find them when Black Manta unexpectedly sent Arthur a list of the bombs' locations. [ 167 ]
Atlantis then received reports that a unification conference in Xebel, where Mera was speaking, was under attack by Xebelian terrorists. Arthur rushed over with the Atlantean Guard and an army of sea creatures, but by the time he arrived Jackson had already defeated the terrorists and saved the hostages, although Lucia Hyde had been critically injured. Jackson blamed himself and refused anyone's attempts to reach out to him, including Arthur's.
Arthur met with Black Manta at an isolated bar in Iceland and told him about the sleepers. [ 168 ] Manta agreed to help Arthur track down Atlanteans hidden on the surface. He kept this deal secret from everyone, including Jackson. [ 13 ]
Orm attacked the United Nations Building and took the Atlantean ambassador hostage. Arthur and Jackson responded, and the brothers duelled on the floor of the UN. Orm told Arthur that it was the dawn of a new age for Atlantis and that the surface would remember to fear them. When Arthur told Orm that he would not let him win, Orm replied that what was coming was bigger and older than the both of them.
Arthur and Jackson defeated Orm, and after he was taken to prison Arthur again tried to talk to Jackson, concerned at his uncharacteristically aggressive conduct in the fight, including seriously wounding a sea monster that Orm was forcing to obey him. However, Jackson received a notification that Black Manta had been seen murdering a man in the streets of Paris and rushed off to capture him. In Paris, Jackson tracked Manta to his hideout and attacked his father in a blind rage, but Arthur stopped him and told him that Black Manta was on their side. [ 169 ]
Jackson knocked them both aside with a tidal wave and fled with Martin's body. Arthur told Manta that Jonas Martin, and presumably other sleepers, had been activated and took him to the hidden broadcast station that their activation signal originated from. The equipment required two people to operate it, and they found one corpse at the controls, meaning the other person was still at large. [ 170 ] They deactivated the machine and escaped the collapsing broadcast station but Mera tracked them down and demanded to know what was going on. Arthur admitted what he knew about the sleepers and she told them that Jackson had gone to Gotham City to confront the people responsible.
Aquaman, Aquaman & Black Manta team up
Arthur and Manta rushed to Gotham to find Jackson fighting Scavenger, who was equipped with upgraded armor. [ 13 ] Manta and Jackson fought Scavenger while Arthur helped Batwoman protect civilians. After Scavenger got away the three of them returned to Atlantis and Arthur told the Aquaman Family what was going on. [ 171 ] Mera and Jackson worked to build a transmitter to deactivate the sleepers, while Arthur took command of the Manta Men to foil any attacks in the interim. They successfully sent the deactivation signal but one of the sleepers, a man known as Bob Moss , was unaffected and managed to get into Atlantis and kill the council in a suicide bombing. [ 172 ]
In the aftermath of the attack Arthur gave Mera control over the vault of contingencies which General Mako had shown him all those years ago, and told her to use or destroy the weapons inside as she saw fit. Mera was still upset with him for his lies, but before they could talk Arthur was called away by the Justice League to deal with an emergency. He left, promising Mera that they would discuss everything when he got back. [ 173 ]
Dark Crisis
The Justice League were called to the House of Heroes by Justice League Incarnate , who told them that the Great Darkness had captured Barry Allen and was attempting to invade the Multiverse. Doctor Multiverse teleported them to where the Darkness was attempting to enter reality, which was revealed to be the ruins of the pre- Crisis Multiverse. They found Pariah building a portal which would allow the Darkness to enter their reality. Pariah unleashed the Dark Army , a band of cosmic villains possessed by the Darkness, on them. Arthur battled Doomsday alongside his Earth 11 counterpart .
Aquaman & The Justice League die
Green Arrow destroyed Pariah's portal with an explosive arrow, and in a rage Pariah seemingly annihilated the assembled heroes with a wave of energy. [ 174 ] In reality, they had each been sent to their own pocket dimensions, designed to be perfect worlds they would never want to leave. Arthur awoke on a world where his parents were both alive and together, Andy had grown up to be Aquawoman and every friend he had ever made was safe and happy. Arthur realized that the world he was in was too good to be true and, knowing that Pariah was watching, told him that he would escape and kill him. [ 175 ]
Lazarus Planet
Aquaman & The world react to the Lazarus resin
After the volcanic eruption on Lazarus Island , Arthur discovered a mutated species of Trench off the coast of New England . [ 176 ]
Dawn of DC
Knight Terrors
When the supervillain Insomnia plunged the world's heroes into a forced slumber, Aquaman and his fellow Atlanteans proved immune to his mix of science and supernatural. The Aquaman family scramblesd to protect the world in the absence of other heroes, even accepting help from a reformed Drenched . While Arthur and Mera looked after the unconscious bodies of Superman and Supergirl , they were ambushed by one of Insomnia's Sleepless Knights , before the Kryptonians recover and defeat the Knight. [ 177 ]
Absolute Power
Aquaman, Garth and the Doom Patrol were ambushed by the Task Force VII android Depth Charge , who stole their powers and took Aquaman prisoner. Amanda Waller wanted Atlantis to ally with the Bureau of Sovereignty and tasked Depth Charge with diplomatic outreach, believing that the Atlanteans hated superheroes as much as she did and would welcome the Bureau as liberators from Aquaman's "tyranny". Depth Charge had a much more realistic understanding and so came with an army of sharks and the powerless Aquaman as a hostage. Aquaman ordered the Atlantean Guard to stand down rather than allow them to risk their lives fighting Depth Charge. They complied, but Depth Charge flew into a rage, declaring that he was now king of Atlantis and they should be obeying him instead. During Depth Charge's rampage, Aquaman was able to escape to the surface with the Doom Patrol and join the assembled heroes at the Fortress of Solitude . [ 178 ]
Aquaman & many other heroes are powerless
The Fortress was then attacked by the Brainiac Queen , Global Guardian and a brainwashed Jon Kent . Aquaman helped to fight the attackers off, but they were soon overwhelmed and fled through a portal to Themyscira . [ 179 ] The heroes regrouped and Nightwing took charge of the survivors. He tasked Aquaman to lead a team to rescue Time Commander from the Bureau, as they had used his time-travel technology to make Task Force VII effectively indestructible. The team was successful, but Red Tornado was destroyed. [ 180 ]
The heroes attacked the Bureau's stronghold on Gamorra Island , and used a device built by Time Commander to release the superpowers stolen by Task Force VII. The re-empowered heroes easily destroyed the robots and fought through the Bureau's soldiers. Amanda Waller was arrested and imprisoned for her crimes. [ 181 ]
All In
The heroes decided to reform the Justice League, now with a significantly expanded roster and known as Justice League Unlimited. Aquaman and Mera attended their first meeting on the new Watchtower, which was attacked by Darkseid. Darkseid was seemingly destroyed in the fight, leaving behind a rift in reality. The JLU soon determined that the rift lead to "The Elseworld" , one of the two poles of the Multiverse, and it was now giving off a similar energy signature as Darkseid. Booster Gold went in to investigate but did not return, although he should have been automatically pulled out after ten minutes. [ 182 ]
Following Amanda Waller's campaign, Arthur was elected as king once again by the Atlantean parliament, who believed that strong leadership was needed in a time of crisis. He also gained Mera's hydrokinetic abilities following the mass theft and return of superpowers by Task Force VII. Several weeks after Amanda Waller was foiled, Jackson brought a mysterious pearl which he had found on an adventure with Miss Martian into Atlantis. He said that Garth was able to determine it was magical but nothing else, and he had a bad feeling about it.
When a monster made of water attacked Daytona Beach in Florida, Aquaman swam up to the surface to stop it. Using his new hydrokinetic powers he was able to dissolve the creature back into the ocean, but he then heard Mera calling for him from Atlantis. He swam back to the city at top speed, arriving just in time to see it disappear in a flash of bright light, leaving only the pearl behind. Arthur went to the Justice League for help and Zatanna determined that the pearl was a source of ancient power, but could not learn anything more as the peal was shielded against her magical scans. She sensed a similar magical signature under the sea and Arthur swam to its location, accompanied by Batman and Wonder Woman. He found what appeared to be an arch covered in seaweed, and when the pearl was brought near it a portal opened up. He swam through, hoping to find his family on the other side. Unbeknownst to him, when the portal closed it had stripped the growth from the arch; revealing that it was an Omega, the symbol of Darkseid. [ 183 ]
Aquaman emerged through the portal on an alien world at the bottom of a dry seabed. He was attacked by creatures called the Grindylow , figures of Earth folklore. Aquaman easily overpowered the Grindylow and made them lead him to their leader: the water hag Jenny Greenteeth . Arthur told her that he was just looking for Atlantis and didn't want to fight, but she told him that "The Blue" had stopped providing water to the world and she needed to harvest it wherever she could, including from his blood. She summoned up vines that bound him and dragged him through the floor.
He emerged in a basement, suspended from the ceiling by the vines, which cut him and allowed his blood to drip into a cistern below. Another prisoner, his distant ancestor Arion , told Arthur that he could use his power over water to control the blood and free them. With intense focus, Arthur was able to draw the blood from the cistern and cut them free. The fell into the cistern below and Arion said they should escape, but Arthur refused to leave and said evil like Jenny should be destroyed. He erupted up through the ceiling on a wave of blood into Jenny's throne room and attacked her. He sensed that she was possessing the body of another and forced her out, then ripped the Greenteeth parasite apart. Jenny fled, saying " Dagon lives" and she disappeared into the ground. Arion and the woman Jenny had been possessing knelt to him, declaring that he was the prophesied "Dark Tide". [ 184 ]
Arion and the woman who Jenny Greenteeth had possessed; who was revealed to be Vivienne , the Lady of the Lake, lead Arthur away from the dry riverbed to a wall of ice. They scaled the wall, and at the top found a lake surrounded by banks of ice with an anvil floating in the centre and another gate on the opposite shore. Arion told Aquaman that they needed to craft him a new weapon to kill Dagon and fulfil the prophecy, but Arthur angrily retorted that he didn't care about the prophecy and just wanted to find his family. Arion implied that Dagon stole them and Arthur, exasperated by Arion's cryptic remarks, demanded to know what was going on. Arion told Arthur that Dagon had taken control of The Blue and was hoarding all water in the universe for himself, meaning life itself would soon die. When Dagon recalled the waters to himself, he also accidentally drew Atlantis into his realm as well through the pearl, as it had its own connection to The Blue. Aquaman reluctantly agreed to wait for them to do what they needed and gave Vivienne a sample of his blood to create a weapon bound to his soul.
Vivienne and Arion created a magic shield around the forge and sent Aquaman outside as the mystic energies they would be using were dangerous. While he was waiting the gate on the shore opened and three mermaids emerged, including Lori Lemaris who he knew from an adventure with Superman and Batman. Arthur asked them what they were doing there and Lori replied they had come for him. She suddenly stabbed him in the gut, whispering an apology as she did so. A freezing poison spread from the wound, turning Aquaman's body to ice, and the mermaids carried him through the portal. He returned to normal and woke up on a galley sailing through space. Lori told him they were taking him to Dagon. [ 185 ]
Aquaman attempts to free people from Dagon's control
Arthur was unable to break his chains but was able to weaken the wood of the ship by drawing the water from it to dry it out and then smash his way out. He escaped the ship still in his chains and fled from Lori and the other Mercenary Maids . He ran into Vivienne and Arion, who were able to free him and give him his new weapon, Thalassa the Trilance Saber . With the powerful new weapon, Arthur was able to cut the ship in half with a single swing and scatter the Mercenary Maids. Arion told them to run back to Dagon and tell them a new king had come. [ 186 ]
The trio went into the nearby city to find transport, but learned that Dog had forbidden people to travel freely through The Blue. They saw a man being accosted by guards and, despite Arion warning him to stay out of it and maintain a low profile, Aquaman jumped in a fought off the guards. The man introduced himself as Captain Nemo and explained that he had been sentenced to death for exploring The Blue against Dagon's commands. Arthur asked if he had seen Atlantis and Nemo replied that he had, but it was far away and he could not take them told them there because his ship, the Nautilus , had been seized by the magistrates who ruled the city on behalf of Dagon. Arthur deliberately got himself arrested to enter the courthouse while the others followed him under an invisibility spell. Once they were inside Arthur broke his chains, the fought off the guards and ran for the Nautilus, then set sail for Atlantis. [ 187 ]
Before making the final leg of the journey to Atlantis the Nautilus needed to stop off at the "Haven of the Divine Deep", a place where sea gods drawn into The Blue by an event known as the "Great Ebb" had gathered, in order to resupply. When they reached it they found it in ruins and realised that Dagon had been there and likely left traps behind for them, but the Haven was the only place where they could collect the fuel rods the Nautilus required. They entered the city and Nemo lead them to the chamber where the fuel rods were stored. Also in the room there was a bottle on a plinth which Arion identified as a "Cask of Capture" and sensed an angry living being within. They were attacked by the zombified sea gods, who had been killed by Dagon. Arthur tried to fend them off but they were relentless and Arion was unable to banish whatever spell animated them. In desperation he opened the cask and a jet of pure water exploded out. It hit each of the dead gods in turn, purging them of Dagon's infection and returning them to mere corpses. To Arthur's surprise, the water then formed into Zan , one of the Wonder Twins . [ 188 ]
Nemo sailed the Nautilus into a flow-way, an undersea current that lead them to Atlantis' new location within a seaweed forest. They set down within the city and Arthur rushed out to look for Mera. He saw a redheaded woman who resembled Mera and swam over to her calling her name. However, the woman did not recognise him and asked what he wanted with her mother, to Arthur's confusion. Garth and Jackson ran up to Arthur, but he was shocked to see they were both old men with grey hair. They embraced him and said he had been gone for decades, when Atlantis had only vanished from Earth a month ago. Arion told him that The Blue drew from the future and the past, and reasoned that some form of time dilation must have taken place.
Arthur realised that the redheaded woman was Andy, now grown up. Andy, who now went by her full name Andrina, did not remember Arthur or respect him, believing he was the man who couldn't save Atlantis. Nevertheless, at his request she took him to see Mera, who was now elderly and bedridden. She asked them to watch over each other as she did nor have long to live, and warned Arthur that Dagon was coming. As Mera predicted Garth soon ran in and told them that Dagon was in the city. Arthur promised Mera that he would kill Dagon and return to her, but Mera told him he could not win and only asked him to escape and get Andrina to safety, then died. Her final words were "I... love..." Andrina was devastated but Arthur simply kissed Mera on her forehead and turned to leave. Andrina accused him of running again and not even taking a moment to mourn Mera, but Arthur replied that he would mourn her after he had killed Dagon. She grabbed her own trident and yelled that she would kill him first. The two of them charged out of the room at Dagon, who had transformed into a giant. [ 189 ]
Aquaman and Andrina were quickly joined in their fight by Arthur's new friends, but Garth and Jackson stood by. He called on them to help as he was bound by one of Dagon's tentacles, but Lori said that if they fought against Dagon he would kill them. Arthur retorted that Dagon would kill them all anyway and his former sidekicks decided to fight in Mera's honour, but as soon as they said that Dagon instantly killed them both. Enraged, Arthur broke free of the tentacle. Dagon started to overwhelm them and so Nemo shot Dagon with torpedoes, but he was unharmed. Dagon transformed into his true, monstrous form and Arthur called on Lori to see what she served. He charged at Dagon and Lori and her Mer-cenaries followed him, defecting to his side. Arthur almost managed to reach Dagon, but at the last second he was run through in the chest by one of Dagon's tentacles and fell to the ground, mortally wounded. Andy caught him as he fell, calling him father. Arthur whispered "I'm sorry" to her before he passed out.
However, Arthur did not die; instead he heard the voice of The Blue in his head. It told him that Darkseid's Omega Energy had infected the universe and asked him to be its counter and avatar. Arthur agreed and The Blue healed him and granted him the power he would need to stop Dagon. Revived, he charged at Dagon, blazing with energy and wielding a sword of water. He was able to repeatedly strike Dagon, cutting off several tentacles and his eye, before the evil god caught him. Dagon swallowed Arthur whole, but this was what Arthur had planned as The Blue had told him that Dagon possessed another pearl which he was using to control The Blue and kept it inside his body. Arthur found the pearl and destroyed Dagon with a blast of his new power. He then crushed the pearl and told his surviving allies it was time to go home. [ 190 ]
Powers and Abilities
Powers
Atlantean Hybridized Physiology : Like most Atlanteans, Arthur Curry is an offshoot homo sapien who is biologically adapted to the deep ocean environment. For most Atlanteans, this means they can breathe underwater, endure the pressures of the deep (among other adaptations), and can only spend a very limited time out of water. However due to either Aquaman's hybrid nature or his royal heritage, he possesses a number of traits others of his mother's side of the species do not; for instance he can spend an elongated time on dry land with little ill effect and is shown to be 20–50 times stronger, faster, tougher and more or less tireless compared to others of his race. Also akin to other amphibian life is his ability to not only function indefinitely within water but to easily withstand the crushing depths of the ocean deep, as well as the harsh environment of the sea itself. These powers make Arthur among other things a super-Atlantean as well as superhuman. Superhuman Durability : Tough enough to resist small arms fire with minor injury, the teeth of most trench dwellers break upon contact with his body. He survived an RPG blowing in his face and can thrive in the darkest, deepest bowels of the ocean deep suffering no discomfort. He even lived through falling back to Earth after being launched into orbit by Mera, coming back down hard on top of a sea monsters head, without injury. [ 191 ] He can also spend prolonged periods of time in the void of space without any discomfort although he still needs to breathe. [ 192 ] He also survived Flash channeling the Speed Force of an entire planet through his body without any injury. [ 193 ] Energy and Heat Resistance : Arthur has taken and lived through multiple energy blasts in the past, including being flash frozen by the dead king's ice magic. His ultimate resilience was tested when he dipped into an open lava bed beneath the sea and emerged unscathed. [ 36 ] Superhuman Stamina : Aquaman is able to function much longer than any human, without tiring or becoming weak. Superhuman Senses : Aquaman's senses are several times more acute than human capacity; he once even heard a police siren from several miles away. His senses are similarly enhanced beyond the regular human norm, he can see perfectly fine in the pitch black abyss of an oceanic trench as well as hear things from a good distance away even while deep beneath the ocean line. [ 17 ] Superhuman Hearing Superhuman Vision Superhuman Reflexes : Aquaman's reflexes are heightened to levels far beyond that of any human. Superhuman Speed : Arthur is phenomenally fast be it while running or swimming. In the sea he was able to outrace a spy plane owned by the Operative which can travel up to speeds of Mach 5. [ 194 ] He has also being able to race the Flash to a draw in a underwater race. [ 195 ] Superhuman Strength : Aquaman's super-Atlantean status enables him to lift insurmountable amounts of weight, for instance towing around fishing boats while tidal waves were crashing down upon them. [ 20 ] He is capable of knocking the likes of Superman and Wonder Woman several dozen feet away with singular blows, [ 196 ] lifting a 160,000-ton sea liner barehanded, [ 26 ] and lifting and throwing a sunken cargo ship. [ 33 ] [ 34 ] Some of his greatest feats of might include pushing a tectonic plate over the entrance to the trench's lair, [ 197 ] and matching the legendary Hercules blow for blow. [ 198 ] [ 58 ] Super-Leaping : Aquaman can make use of his powerful bodily muscles to launch himself into the air, either jumping on and off land or propelling himself out of open water like a torpedo. [ 17 ] Accelerated Healing : Aquaman is able to recover from wounds far quicker then any human. It took him a matter of days to recover from his fight with the Shaggy Man. [ 93 ]

Normally he needs an item of power through which he can channel these abilities; like an imperial polearm of national design. Indicating this power is more innate than reliant on a channeling apparatus. [ 129 ] Magic Resistance : Arthur is more resilient against arcane forces thanks to his dormant magical capacity. [ 133 ]
Magic Resistance : Arthur is more resilient against arcane forces thanks to his dormant magical capacity. [ 133 ]
Life Force Connection : Aquaman has access to one of the seven hidden forces of reality related to the life-giving powers of the oceans themselves. [ 199 ] This gives him access to a great many undisclosed abilities the likes of which he has yet to access on his own. [ 200 ] Through the Life Force, Arthur is connected to all living beings as he is to the life giving waters which they spring from. Enabling the established supernatural link to any and all sentient entities throughout the cosmos and back towards earth. [ 200 ] He can use this connection to determine a being's origin as he was able to determinate that the Voidsong comes from an ocean planet after being in close contact with it. [ 193 ] Marine Telepathy : While popular belief is often debated about Aquaman talking to fish or other aquatic fauna. [ 17 ] He can 'Hear' the voice of the sea and 'Communicate' with its many denizens living within it along with those who spring from it. Being capable of sending out worldwide telepathic broadcasts with ease, [ 32 ] and when necessary. Across space & time beyond mere oceanic psychic ability. [ 199 ] Something Arthur has been able to do since when he was very young. [ 201 ] He was able to assume control over the mind of the great sea Leviathan Topo but with extreme levels of difficulty as the stress of such an act left him comatose for six months. [ 35 ] It seems Aquaman has developed better control over his power as commanding Topo to sunder a dreadnought from Thule wasn't as difficult as it used to be. [ 146 ] Even revitalizing them after they'd been subsumed into the primordial goddess Mother Salt. [ 148 ] He could also use his powers to keep a divine beast from overtaking Caille's body and mind, enabling her to assume it's power without losing herself to it. [ 146 ]

Hydrokinesis : Arthur gained Mera's ability to control water after the mass theft and release of superpowers during Amanda Waller's war on superheroes. [ 183 ] This ability extends to any liquid or semi-liquid substance containing significant quantities of water such as mud or blood. He can control mud in a similar manner to water, using it as an offensive projectile. [ 184 ] Blood Control : Arthur can use his mastery over water to manipulate the flow of blood. He can use his power to shape blood into powerful waves, as well as project powerful blasts of blood from his hands and even his feet, to launch himself. He was even able to pull his own lost blood back into his body. [ 184 ] Cryokinesis : Aquaman can control and create simple objects from ice. [ 185 ]

Enhanced Senses : Aquaman can sense anything that happens in any ocean on Earth. [ 202 ]
Invulnerability : His connection to The Blue enhanced Aquaman's already superhuman resistance to damage. He is able to withstand a full-strength punch from a possessed Superman and jump from the Watchtower in orbit above Earth into the Atlantic Ocean without suffering any harm. [ 202 ]
Abilities
Occultism [ 112 ]
Hand-to-Hand Combat (Advanced) : Arthur has beaten Black Manta in one-on-one combat. [ 203 ] It has been revealed that Arthur was trained by Wonder Woman. [ 116 ] [ 204 ] Aquaman has admitted that he has trained with Batman. [ 205 ] [ 206 ]
Politics : As a King Arthur is an adept politician.

Diplomacy : Arthur succeeded in stopping two wars between Atlantis and the surface. [ 96 ] [ 196 ]

Paraphernalia
Equipment
Shell of Sounds : Given to him by his mother. A relic that can contain recorded memories and dialog from the user, in order to convey their memories to future generations. [ 209 ]
Tenth Metal Armor (Formerly) : During his final battle with the Dark Knights and Barbatos, Aquaman and other members of the Justice League were gifted with suits of armor made from the element of creation itself. [ 125 ] The Tenth Metal enables the changing and reshaping of all reality. Using the Element X armor, all of Arthur's natural powers were greatly bolstered. Tenth Metal can also change and morph its physical shape as well as bring the wearer's thoughts and desires into reality. Arthur wearing the Tenth Metal armor caused Atlantis to rise out of the ocean into open air, as this was something he subconsciously wished for. [ 129 ]
Transportation
Storm : Aquaman's faithful seahorse steed.
Weapons
Thalassa the Trilance Saber : A powerful weapon forged by the Lady of the Lake . It can change from a sword to a trident. With it Arthur was able to cut a ship in half with a single swing. It is bound to his soul by his blood being mixed into the metal when it was forged. [ 186 ] Electro-Blast [ 187 ]
Electro-Blast [ 187 ]
Trident of Neptune (Formerly) : Forged from enchanted gold by Atlan, first king of Atlantis, the Trident of Neptune serves as a symbolism of the royal line. Arthur wields the Trident as both his right to rule and as a lethal weapon which can pierce mystical defences and draw blood from New Gods like Darkseid. He eventually lost this trident when the villainous Siren, posing as Mera, usurped his leadership and kingdom, but he has since regained it. [ 71 ] Arthur eventually learned his trident is empowered by magical energies. [ 1 ] [ 109 ] The Trident of Neptune strengthened him by awakening his own dormant mystical capacity, enabling to combat magic in many forms. [ 112 ] The Trident was destroyed during Aquaman's battle with the Abyssal Dark-possessed Rath, and currently sits broken in Atlantis. [ 129 ] Energy Transference : The trident of Atlan has a natural proclivity to absorb, distill, channel and redistribute magical energy both from it's host and outside sources. [ 71 ] Enabling the Aquaman to harness and manipulate his own inherent magical power through it, being able to create bundles of arcane energy to attack his enemies with. [ 112 ] His magical abilities are likely due to his regal inheritance. He has already been able to overthrow the Crown of Thorns using his innate magical power as well as resist the effect of others' spells and enchantments. [ 110 ] Eldritch Blast : Arthur can combine his magic and that of the trident to execute great explosions of magic; these explosions are capable of destroying Atlantean fortresses. Through his trident Arthur can discharge potent blasts of raw esoteric power which can put down even the most savvy of magic practitioners. Force Field : He is able to generate barriers of energy through his trident. Physical Augmentation: The magic of his trident seemingly made Arthur all the more powerful as he absorbed its mystical energies.

Trident of Poseidon : A divine blessing bestowed upon him by its previous wielder, Poseidon, the trident granted Aquaman a host of mystical powers and enchantments as a means to help him battle the Thule. He eventually sacrificed it in order to destroy the encroachment of dimensions, [ 73 ] but has been lent a replacement by the gods since then. [ 210 ] Arthur was gifted the relic by Poseidon once again when the vengeful Triumvirate of Sea Gods, who were wronged by the Grecian ocean divinity millennia ago, came to drown the world. [ 211 ] After a lengthy battle with the ancient primal adept Namma with help from a group of old gods, Father Sea bestowed Arthur with his trident once again. [ 212 ] Aquaman bearing Poseidon's blessings Divine Empowerment : After receiving the blessing and trident from the Olympian God of the seas, Poseidon, Aquaman gained various mystical powers. [ 70 ] Weather Manipulation : Aquaman states control over the storm, rain, wind, thunder, and lightning was bestowed upon him. [ 70 ] Geokinesis : Through the trident's magic, AC can cause the very ground and soil to shift and turn at will. Sending rising stalagmites at enemies, trigger earthquakes, raise pillars of rock to uplift people out of danger [ 70 ] Seismokinesis : Arthur Curry can channel the thunderous forces of the earth through the Trident of Poseidon to tear apart the ground beneath his enemies feet. Electrokinesis : Aquaman was capable of summoning bolts of lightning from his trident. [ 70 ] Electro-Blast : Aquaman could project powerful bolts and arcs of electricity from his trident. [ 70 ] Hydrokinesis : Through both his blessings and the Trident given to him, Arthur was able to bend and manipulate water around himself for various purposes. [ 69 ] [ 82 ] Hydroportation : With an extent water source, Arthur could teleport global-interplanetary distances at will. [ 213 ] Cryokinesis : Aquaman was able to use his trident to summon large icicles from the ground, and freeze an Atlantean by grabbing him. Thule Magic Resilience : With the blessing he received from Poseidon, Aquaman was granted a degree of defense against magic, most prominently the magic of Thule users. [ 71 ] Bane Field Manipulation : Even before receiving Poseidon's gifts Arthur showed a limited capacity to bend the poisonous aura of Thule realm structures. [ 70 ] Flight : By Poseidon's blessings, Arthur could fly unaided. [ 214 ] [ 73 ]

Notes
Aquaman was created by Mort Weisinger and Paul Norris , first appearing  in More Fun Comics #73 . However, Aquaman first appeared as part of Prime Earth continuity in Justice League (Volume 2) #1 by Geoff Johns and Jim Lee .
Aquaman (Arthur Curry) appears as Aquaman (Prime) a playable character in the Infinite Crisis video game.

Arsenal(disambiguation)
Roy Harper ( 2011 - Present ) Roy Harper Appearances • Images • Gallery • Quotes
Roy Harper ( 2011 - Present )
Arsenal is the alter-ego of several characters in the DC Universe . It is most prominently used by Roy Harper , who took it after graduating from his role as Green Arrow 's sidekick Speedy and dropped it when he became Red Arrow . Roy returned to his role after his daughter Lian was murdered during Justice League: Cry for Justice . He has been a member of the Titans , Checkmate , Suicide Squad , the Outsiders and the Outlaws .
Harper first began using the name and costume of Arsenal in New Titans #99 ( 1993 ), by Marv Wolfman and Tom Grummett .

Atom(disambiguation)
Ryan Choi ( 2016 - Present ) Ryan Choi Appearances • Images • Gallery • Quotes
Ryan Choi ( 2016 - Present )
The Atom is a legacy super-hero name, primarily associated with the ability to shrink in size. The original was Al Pratt during the Golden Age , a diminutive man with superhuman strength; he was a founding member of the Justice Society . Ray Palmer took the name during the Silver Age , a physics professor at Ivy University who developed equipment to shrink himself down to subatomic levels while maintaining regular mass. Palmer has been a member of the Justice League , Teen Titans , Suicide Squad and Indigo Tribe . Adam Cray also briefly took the mantle using stolen equipment, and it was later used by scientist Ryan Choi until his alleged death.
Al Pratt was created by Ben Flinton and Bill O'Connor , first appearing in All-American Comics #19 ( 1940 ). Ray Palmer was created re-envisioning the concept by Julius Schwartz , Gardner Fox and Gil Kane , first appearing in Showcase #34 ( 1961 ).

Bane(disambiguation)
Bane ( 2011 - Present ) Bane Appearances • Images • Gallery • Quotes
Bane ( 2011 - Present )
Bane is a brilliant world-class fighter and tactical genius who augments his great physical strength with a steroid called Venom . Raised from childhood in the Peña Duro prison on Santa Prisca , he was determined that he would destroy Batman to prove himself, and succeeded by breaking the hero's back during Knightfall . Since then he has been an international crimelord, an anti-hero, a mercenary, a government agent and even a dictator. His father is the legendary martial artist King Snake . He has been a member of the Secret Six , the Suicide Squad , and the Secret Society of Super-Villains .
Bane was created by Dennis O'Neil , Chuck Dixon , and Graham Nolan , first appearing in Batman: Vengeance of Bane #1 ( 1993 ).

Flash (Barry Allen)

Barry Allen is the second speedster to be called the Flash . Using his superspeed powers, he taps into the Speed Force and becomes a costumed crime-fighter. He is also a founding member of the Justice League .
