Powers and Abilities
Powers
Speed Force Conduit : After Barry was struck by a bolt of lightning and doused with chemicals, he gained a connection to the Speed Force—a mysterious cosmic force that pushes time and space itself forward. [ 114 ] [ 115 ] As it does this, the Speed Force creates excess energy that builds up and needs to be released. Barry, and the other speedsters connected to the Speed Force, act effectively as its release valve. When Barry uses his powers, he taps into that built up energy and expends it. [ 25 ] After teaching himself, [ 116 ] along with being trained by Fuerza, [ 117 ] [ 118 ] his future self, [ 119 ] [ 120 ] and Max Mercury; [ 121 ] [ 122 ] Barry learned a greater and more profound understanding of his powers, helping him gain mastery over them. Grodd has admitted that Barry is a master of the science of the Speed Force. [ 123 ] [ 124 ] Barry has stated that he has the potential to evolve when it comes to the terms of his speed and powers. [ 30 ] He later lost his powers when he was caught at ground zero of an exploding Transmatter Portal . [ 125 ] Superhuman Speed : Barry is capable of moving at incredible superhuman speeds. He is far faster than Superman and Supergirl [ 126 ] [ 127 ] and almost as fast as Wally West. Barry can move far beyond lightspeed without any effort, and was even able to move when time was frozen. [ 128 ] [ 57 ] [ 129 ] When he was asleep, Barry moved so fast none of the Flash Family members could catch him, even giving Wally West trouble keeping up with him. [ 130 ] However, Barry is always so immersed in the science of the Speed Force that he doesn't cut loose and simply enjoy his speed, which leaves him a bit slower than Wally West, who is the fastest being in the multiverse. [ 131 ] Superhuman Reflexes : Barry's reaction time is augmented to superhuman levels. His great reflexes have allowed him to perform feats such as dodging lightning. [ 27 ] His body sends pain messages to his brain at such a velocity that the femtosecond he feels something, he will react. [ 21 ] Superhuman Stamina : Barry's body can handle the stress of moving at superhuman speeds for long periods of time without out getting tired or weak. [ 18 ] After being pricked by one of Poison Ivy's toxic thorns, he ran at supersonic speed for more than a day, just to keep the toxin from metabolizing into his bloodstream. Even after running in circles for days non-stop, to keep the toxin from taking over; Barry still had enough stamina to run back and rescue Batman. [ 132 ] Barry can maintain a state of vibrating his molecules for hours on end, even without gravity, before passing out. [ 133 ] Superhuman Agility : Barry's agility, balance, and bodily coordination are enhanced to superhuman levels. This allows him to easily maneuver and leap far distances while moving at superhuman speed. [ 18 ] [ 134 ] [ 135 ] Superhuman Strength : The Flash can use his speed to boost his natural strength. [ 136 ] The faster the Flash accelerates towards lightspeed, the more his mass increases, greatly enhancing the force behind his punches. By moving at just under the speed of light, Barry can perform a "near-infinite mass" punch, which he describes as the mightiest punch in the multiverse. However, he rarely does this, as it can easily deform space-time itself, if he holds it for more than an instant. When Barry used this ability on the Anti-Monitor, the force of Barry's punch was strong enough to knock the Anti-Monitor through multiple realities and nearly defeat him. [ 137 ] Barry can generate enough force through his speed to easily smash through metal walls. [ 138 ] Barry was strong enough to hurl Wally West across a street and into a building, [ 139 ] as well as pull a van carrying ten people in it. [ 140 ] He also carried a large statue from Central City all the way back to Corto Maltese , [ 141 ] and easily snapped Captain Boomerang's metal boomerangs and break apart Darwin Elias' energy gun, with his bare hands. [ 142 ] [ 143 ] Speed Force Aura : The Flash's body is surrounded by a Speed Force Aura, or "friction cushion" - a bubble of space-time accelerated to the same velocity as Barry. [ 144 ] This aura allows Barry to breathe and hear sounds while moving at immense speeds, as well as protects him and anyone who he is running with from the rigorous effects of using his speed, including friction, airborne particulate matter, kinetic impacts, G-Force and the like. [ 145 ] [ 114 ] [ 126 ] Barry can also sync his aura with anyone he chooses, giving him the ability to pull them alongside him with a thought. [ 146 ] He is also capable of using his aura to restrain enemies that are in his aura's vicinity, however this takes immense focus. [ 147 ] By running around enemies, Barry can trap them in a force-field that he creates by compressing his aura. [ 148 ] Superhuman Durability : Thanks to his protective Speed Force aura, Barry is capable of resisting tremendous kinetic impact forces that could easily crush or kill a human, without suffering any serious external or internal injuries. He was able to hit Gorilla Grodd with enough to force to shatter his own armor, and suffered no injury. [ 32 ] Energy Resistance : Barry's Speed Force aura also makes him highly resistant to most energy based attacks, especially electrical attacks. Accelerated Healing : Barry can heal much faster than any regular human, due to his Speed Force Aura accelerating space-time around him, closing his wounds almost instantly. His arm healed within minutes of it being crushed. He was also able to quickly heal from the "bone crushing pressure" and "antagonizing trauma" of being 2,000 feet below the ocean, which dealt extreme damage to his body. [ 149 ] Aerokinesis : By rotating his arms at super speed or running in a circular motion, Barry can create strong vortexes of wind. [ 19 ] [ 126 ] [ 150 ] [ 151 ] He has also used the slipstream of airflow created by his speed to draft millions of gallons of water behind him to keep a small village from flooding, [ 27 ] and pull two 600-ton barges behind him. [ 22 ] He even managed to save a train from jumping off the tracks by creating a slipstream to carry and cushion it, right before creating a vortex to make it stop. [ 38 ] Hawkman stated that when Barry and Wally ran around the world at immense speed, they created winds stronger than he had ever felt over all of his lives. [ 139 ] Dimensional Travel : Barry is capable of using his speed to travel to other universes within the Multiverse, and was even the first person to ever do this, when he traveled between Earth-One and Earth-Two . [ 152 ] [ 153 ] [ 154 ] By running at the speed of light, Barry can open a portal into the Speed Force itself, allowing him to enter and exit the dimension at will. [ 24 ] Using his Speed Mind also enables him to willingly enter the Speed Force, and even bring others with him. [ 32 ] He was also able to run into the Negative Speed Force alongside Eobard Thawne. [ 155 ] Barry can also create dimensional portals by projecting his Speed Force energy. [ 156 ] Electrokinesis : Barry is able to generate and manipulate the electrical energy he draws from the Speed Force. By focusing the lightning in his hands, Barry is able to enhance his strikes, [ 157 ] generate lightning to provide people with warmth, [ 48 ] as well as electrocute people on contact. [ 158 ] When generated at high volumes, Barry's Speed Force energy is powerful enough to disrupt the Green , the Microverse , and even Magic , as well as easily destroy Green Lantern constructs on contact. [ 139 ] He can even pull the entirety of the Speed Force's energy into his body, [ 159 ] and even extend his energy to every living being on the planet. [ 120 ] Barry's electrokinesis is so receptive and potent, that he can rejuvenate himself by absorbing lightning from another source, even if it's not from the Speed Force. [ 160 ] Barry's lightning is even workable underwater. [ 161 ] His lightning can even make shadow monsters solid and can negate them. [ 162 ] Electro-Blast : By focusing his frequency, Barry can turn his body into a lightning rod, in order to build up a Speed Force charge and redirect it. [ 118 ] By doing this, he can project bolts of lightning from his hands. [ 163 ] Barry was also able to forcefully discharge a large burst of lightning from his entire body, to knock back Professor Zoom. [ 157 ] Electromagnetism : Due to his electrical abilities, Barry is able to manipulate the electromagnetic spectrum to some extent. The heat from Barry's lightning creates a thermal expansion that allows Barry's suit to be stored in his ring. [ 164 ] Every time he releases his suit from his ring, the pieces of it are conducted by his lightning to form the suit around him. [ 164 ] He can also manipulate electromagnetism to mentally control the pieces that form his mask, and cause the mask to construct over his face and retract back on command. [ 51 ] Barry can also use his lightning to create electromagnetic fields. [ 165 ] Photokinesis : Barry is able to generate blinding amounts of light through his Speed Force lightning. [ 57 ] By manipulating his aura, Barry can release a powerful blast of light called a "photonic boom." [ 166 ] Energy Transformation : When using excess amounts of Speed Force energy, Barry enters a supercharged state where he essentially becomes pure energy. While in this state, Barry's powers are heightened [ 167 ] [ 168 ] [ 169 ] [ 170 ] [ 171 ] and he can move so fast, that he can exist on multiple planes of reality at once. [ 172 ] [ 173 ] According to Pied Piper, if he wasn't careful, he'd run the risk of hurting himself and/or anyone around him. [ 174 ] Speed Force Absorption : By interlocking energy currents, Barry can drain away the Speed Force [ 50 ] or Negative Speed Force, [ 175 ] from speedsters or other energy sources, such as a Speed Force storm. [ 175 ] Though if the one the Speed Force is being stolen from resists, they may be killed, unless the energy is distributed among multiple people. When drained of his Speed Force energy by Daniel West, Barry was able to directly absorb it back. [ 42 ] Speed Force Negation : By interlocking his Speed Force energy currents with another speedster, Barry is able to temporarily short circuit the other speedsters power, causing a "lightning burst." [ 53 ] Enhanced Mental Process : By tapping into the Speed Force with his brain, Barry can eliminate the natural bottle-necking of information, that occurs due to the limits of human physiology. [ 19 ] Because of this, Barry can think exponentially faster than any normal human, and possesses superhuman mental processing. He has managed to keep track of and process all of a security room's computers in order to watch over a total of 400 people for an unveiling event, while undercover with Batman. [ 176 ] Barry's mind moves so fast that he is heavily resistant to mind control and possesses some resistance to other psychic attacks, because of this. [ 177 ] Barry can see patterns in Chaotic situations. [ 178 ] According to Superman, he can think 3 moves ahead of most people, except for Barry and Wally themselves. [ 179 ] [ 180 ] Barry can think quickly, mapping out the potential outcomes of a situation and reading books in an instant. [ 181 ] Speed Mind : By tapping into the Speed Force with his brain, Barry has the ability to tactically assess and predict the numerous possible and probable outcomes of almost any given situation. [ 182 ] [ 183 ] By playing advanced variable examinations within his head he can simulate a quick pre-play sequence of a number of causes, effects, and inevitable outcomes at an accelerated rate. [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 28 ] Barry's speed mind has also allowed him to instantly learn to operate a Green Lantern Ring . [ 184 ] Barry can even use the Speed Mind to send his consciousness into the Speed Force to check other timelines in the span of a second. [ 185 ] Flash can also use this ability to push out into the Speed Force and feel beyond the limits of his mind. [ 186 ] Enhanced Senses : The Speed Force grants Barry enhanced senses that allow him to perceive the world at a rate attuned his reaction speed. [ 18 ] He can feel the slightest changes in air pressure around him, as well as electromagnetic pulses, in objects such as glass. [ 187 ] He can also sense the whereabouts of other Speed Force conduits, by using their connection as a homing beacon and track them. [ 38 ] Flash can even sense the vibrational frequency of any world in the multiverse. [ 188 ] [ 189 ] Even while being stalled in frozen time, Barry's senses still allowed him to notice it. [ 190 ] [ 191 ] [ 119 ] [ 192 ] [ 193 ] Flash can sense the vibrational frequency of any world in the multiverse. [ 188 ] [ 194 ] Enhanced Vision : Barry is able to vibrate his eyes on different frequencies in order to see different wavelengths of light, essentially seeing things that would be invisible to most people. He also has an enhanced range of sight, that allows him to see things clearly from far farther away than normal humans. He can also see objects before the light from them reaches the pupil of his eye. [ 195 ] While vibrating at super speed, he even managed to see Golden Glider who appeared invisible to everyone else. [ 29 ] Barry can watch camera video feed in fast forward and perceive each individual image frame by frame. [ 196 ] Due to his powers, Barry can also see supernatural beings that remain invisible to most people, e.g. the House of Mystery or spirits. [ 195 ] [ 197 ] [ 196 ] Cosmic Awareness : Like other speedsters, due to his connection to the Speed Force, Barry can sense cosmic and temporal disturbances from the Timestream. He can even sense when someone's trying to tap into the Speed Force. [ 198 ] Barry has even broken the Fourth Wall . [ 199 ] [ 200 ] Speed Force Visions : The Speed Force will sometimes give Barry visions of the future as a warning sense, as well as tidbits of information in regards to what's coming next. [ 47 ] The visions are fast but largely incoherent, piecing together bits and pieces of random upcoming events that have yet to happen while also depicting instants mirroring what led up to various continuity reboots. [ 201 ] One of the dangers of this power however, causes acute mental destabilization with each burst of insight; after having a second blast of possible future outcomes making him psychologically unstable. [ 54 ] Speed Force Empathy : The Speed Force grants Barry an empathetic connection to other conduits of the Speed Force, allowing Barry to sense their emotions. [ 52 ] Molecular Acceleration : Barry can vibrate his own molecular structure at varying degrees for a number of purposes, by adjusting to different frequencies. [ 202 ] [ 203 ] When vibrating at a high enough frequency, he can cause things to explode on contact. [ 18 ] He can even do this to an opponent. [ 204 ] Flash has even vibrated himself at 10,000 vibrations per second. [ 205 ] When possessed by a ghost, Barry was able to adjust his frequency in order to trap the spirit in his body, while still staying in control. [ 196 ] Barry also managed to reassemble his body's molecules, when his vibrations were disrupted and his molecules were scattered apart. [ 206 ] He also managed to break free from false reality, just by vibrating. [ 188 ] When vibrating at a certain frequency, Barry can also disrupt constructs of magic. [ 207 ] [ 208 ] By vibrating himself and the Cosmic Treadmill at a fast enough frequency, Barry was able to send a vibration into the skulls of the Flash Family to communicate a message to them, like "voices down a tin-can thread." [ 147 ] Phasing : By vibrating his molecules on an atomic level, and by doing so at just the right frequency, he can allow himself to become momentarily intangible, and phase through objects. [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 32 ] Intangibility : By accelerating his molecular frequency to a high enough degree, Barry can make his body intangible and allow projectiles to pass through him. [ 32 ] [ 38 ] [ 209 ] Flash can use this ability to bypass dangers, such as explosions. [ 210 ] He can even cause other people or objects to become intangible, through contact. He was able to vibrate an entire airplane and everyone in it, in order to pass through a bridge. [ 20 ] Invisibility : By vibrating at a high frequency, Barry can turn himself invisible to the naked eye. [ 29 ] [ 211 ] Thermokinesis : Barry can use his vibrations to generate heat, especially when it comes to thawing people out of ice or just warming people up. [ 22 ] [ 30 ] [ 167 ] Retrocognition : Barry has shown on multiple occasions that he can remember certain events erased from his mind. He was able to remember Wally West when he reached out to Barry though the Speed Force, despite his memories of Wally being erased. [ 46 ] He was also able to remember his pre-flashpoint history with Eobard Thawne. [ 212 ] Sharing the Force : Barry is able to use the Speed Force to "lend" velocity to objects or people already in motion. Barry may lend his speed and angular momentum to another object or person. [ 184 ] [ 213 ] This may allow others to run alongside with the Flash. Barry did this with Wallace West by "locking" him in with his speed, granting him the boost needed to move at Barry's speed. [ 57 ] Speed Steal : Barry admits that he can steal speed from others, but he needs to be in close range in order to do it. [ 199 ] [ 214 ] When infected by the Negative Speed Force, Barry stole all of Reverse-Flash's speed. [ 215 ] Time Acceleration : During one of his battles with Professor Zoom, Barry realized that he can use the Speed Force to move time forward, allowing him to speed up the flow of time. By doing this, Barry was able to negate Zoom's power to slow time. In this instance, this power caused Barry's lightning to turn white. [ 157 ] In a battle with the Turtle, Barry used the Speed Force to connect with every living being on the planet, in order to speed up time a few seconds into the future and bring everyone else with him, except for the Turtle. [ 120 ] Time Travel : Barry can use his speed to travel throughout the time stream. [ 39 ] [ 42 ] While originally needing the Cosmic Treadmill to achieve this, [ 60 ] [ 216 ] Barry eventually learned to time travel on his own. [ 42 ] [ 215 ] Barry has also raced along the borders of hypertime , the part of the time stream where overarching and interconnected web of timelines and realities exist. [ 217 ] [ 218 ] Because of Barry's ability to travel through time, he has the power to potentially alter the timeline, as he had previously changed it on his own power, during the Flashpoint. [ 212 ] [ 216 ]
Superhuman Speed : Barry is capable of moving at incredible superhuman speeds. He is far faster than Superman and Supergirl [ 126 ] [ 127 ] and almost as fast as Wally West. Barry can move far beyond lightspeed without any effort, and was even able to move when time was frozen. Aerokinesis : By rotating his arms at super speed or running in a circular motion, Barry can create strong vortexes of wind. [ 19 ] [ 126 ] [ 150 ] [ 151 ] He has also used the slipstream of airflow created by his speed to draft millions of gallons of water behind him to keep a small village from flooding, [ 27 ] and pull two 600-ton barges behind him. [ 22 ] He even managed to save a train from jumping off the tracks by creating a slipstream to carry and cushion it, right before creating a vortex to make it stop. [ 38 ] Hawkman stated that when Barry and Wally ran around the world at immense speed, they created winds stronger than he had ever felt over all of his lives. [ 139 ]
Dimensional Travel : Barry is capable of using his speed to travel to other universes within the Multiverse, and was even the first person to ever do this, when he traveled between Earth-One and Earth-Two . [ 152 ] [ 153 ] [ 154 ] By running at the speed of light, Barry can open a portal into the Speed Force itself, allowing him to enter and exit the dimension at will. [ 24 ] Using his Speed Mind also enables him to willingly enter the Speed Force, and even bring others with him. [ 32 ] He was also able to run into the Negative Speed Force alongside Eobard Thawne. [ 155 ] Barry can also create dimensional portals by projecting his Speed Force energy. [ 156 ]
Electrokinesis : Barry is able to generate and manipulate the electrical energy he draws from the Speed Force. By focusing the lightning in his hands, Barry is able to enhance his strikes, [ 157 ] generate lightning to provide people with warmth, [ 48 ] as well as electrocute people on contact. [ 158 ] When generated at high volumes, Barry's Speed Force energy is powerful enough to disrupt the Green , the Microverse , and even Magic , as well as easily destroy Green Lantern constructs on contact. [ 139 ] He can even pull the entirety of the Speed Force's energy into his body, [ 159 ] and even extend his energy to every living being on the planet. [ 120 ] Barry's electrokinesis is so receptive and potent, that he can rejuvenate himself by absorbing lightning from another source, even if it's not from the Speed Force. [ 160 ] Barry's lightning is even workable underwater. [ 161 ] His lightning can even make shadow monsters solid and can negate them. [ 162 ] Electro-Blast : By focusing his frequency, Barry can turn his body into a lightning rod, in order to build up a Speed Force charge and redirect it. [ 118 ] By doing this, he can project bolts of lightning from his hands. [ 163 ] Barry was also able to forcefully discharge a large burst of lightning from his entire body, to knock back Professor Zoom. [ 157 ] Electromagnetism : Due to his electrical abilities, Barry is able to manipulate the electromagnetic spectrum to some extent. The heat from Barry's lightning creates a thermal expansion that allows Barry's suit to be stored in his ring. [ 164 ] Every time he releases his suit from his ring, the pieces of it are conducted by his lightning to form the suit around him. [ 164 ] He can also manipulate electromagnetism to mentally control the pieces that form his mask, and cause the mask to construct over his face and retract back on command. [ 51 ] Barry can also use his lightning to create electromagnetic fields. [ 165 ] Photokinesis : Barry is able to generate blinding amounts of light through his Speed Force lightning. [ 57 ] By manipulating his aura, Barry can release a powerful blast of light called a "photonic boom." [ 166 ] Energy Transformation : When using excess amounts of Speed Force energy, Barry enters a supercharged state where he essentially becomes pure energy. While in this state, Barry's powers are heightened [ 167 ] [ 168 ] [ 169 ] [ 170 ] [ 171 ] and he can move so fast, that he can exist on multiple planes of reality at once. [ 172 ] [ 173 ] According to Pied Piper, if he wasn't careful, he'd run the risk of hurting himself and/or anyone around him. [ 174 ] Speed Force Absorption : By interlocking energy currents, Barry can drain away the Speed Force [ 50 ] or Negative Speed Force, [ 175 ] from speedsters or other energy sources, such as a Speed Force storm. [ 175 ] Though if the one the Speed Force is being stolen from resists, they may be killed, unless the energy is distributed among multiple people. When drained of his Speed Force energy by Daniel West, Barry was able to directly absorb it back. [ 42 ] Speed Force Negation : By interlocking his Speed Force energy currents with another speedster, Barry is able to temporarily short circuit the other speedsters power, causing a "lightning burst." Enhanced Mental Process : By tapping into the Speed Force with his brain, Barry can eliminate the natural bottle-necking of information, that occurs due to the limits of human physiology. [ 19 ] Because of this, Barry can think exponentially faster than any normal human, and possesses superhuman mental processing. He has managed to keep track of and process all of a security room's computers in order to watch over a total of 400 people for an unveiling event, while undercover with Batman. [ 176 ] Barry's mind moves so fast that he is heavily resistant to mind control and possesses some resistance to other psychic attacks, because of this. [ 177 ] Barry can see patterns in Chaotic situations. [ 178 ] According to Superman, he can think 3 moves ahead of most people, except for Barry and Wally themselves. [ 179 ] [ 180 ] Barry can think quickly, mapping out the potential outcomes of a situation and reading books in an instant. [ 181 ] Speed Mind : By tapping into the Speed Force with his brain, Barry has the ability to tactically assess and predict the numerous possible and probable outcomes of almost any given situation. [ 182 ] [ 183 ] By playing advanced variable examinations within his head he can simulate a quick pre-play sequence of a number of causes, effects, and inevitable outcomes at an accelerated rate. [ 19 ] [ 20 ] [ 28 ] Barry's speed mind has also allowed him to instantly learn to operate a Green Lantern Ring . [ 184 ] Barry can even use the Speed Mind to send his consciousness into the Speed Force to check other timelines in the span of a second. [ 185 ] Flash can also use this ability to push out into the Speed Force and feel beyond the limits of his mind. [ 186 ]

Enhanced Senses : The Speed Force grants Barry enhanced senses that allow him to perceive the world at a rate attuned his reaction speed. [ 18 ] He can feel the slightest changes in air pressure around him, as well as electromagnetic pulses, in objects such as glass. [ 187 ] He can also sense the whereabouts of other Speed Force conduits, by using their connection as a homing beacon and track them. [ 38 ] Flash can even sense the vibrational frequency of any world in the multiverse. [ 188 ] [ 189 ] Even while being stalled in frozen time, Barry's senses still allowed him to notice it. [ 190 ] [ 191 ] [ 119 ] [ 192 ] [ 193 ] Flash can sense the vibrational frequency of any world in the multiverse. [ 188 ] [ 194 ] Enhanced Vision : Barry is able to vibrate his eyes on different frequencies in order to see different wavelengths of light, essentially seeing things that would be invisible to most people. He also has an enhanced range of sight, that allows him to see things clearly from far farther away than normal humans. He can also see objects before the light from them reaches the pupil of his eye. [ 195 ] While vibrating at super speed, he even managed to see Golden Glider who appeared invisible to everyone else. [ 29 ] Barry can watch camera video feed in fast forward and perceive each individual image frame by frame. [ 196 ] Due to his powers, Barry can also see supernatural beings that remain invisible to most people, e.g. the House of Mystery or spirits. [ 195 ] [ 197 ] [ 196 ] Cosmic Awareness : Like other speedsters, due to his connection to the Speed Force, Barry can sense cosmic and temporal disturbances from the Timestream. He can even sense when someone's trying to tap into the Speed Force. [ 198 ] Barry has even broken the Fourth Wall . [ 199 ] [ 200 ] Speed Force Visions : The Speed Force will sometimes give Barry visions of the future as a warning sense, as well as tidbits of information in regards to what's coming next. [ 47 ] The visions are fast but largely incoherent, piecing together bits and pieces of random upcoming events that have yet to happen while also depicting instants mirroring what led up to various continuity reboots. [ 201 ] One of the dangers of this power however, causes acute mental destabilization with each burst of insight; after having a second blast of possible future outcomes making him psychologically unstable. [ 54 ] Speed Force Empathy : The Speed Force grants Barry an empathetic connection to other conduits of the Speed Force, allowing Barry to sense their emotions. [ 52 ]

Molecular Acceleration : Barry can vibrate his own molecular structure at varying degrees for a number of purposes, by adjusting to different frequencies. [ 204 ] Flash has even vibrated himself at 10,000 vibrations per second. Sharing the Force : Barry is able to use the Speed Force to "lend" velocity to objects or people already in motion. Barry may lend his speed and angular momentum to another object or person. [ 184 ] [ 213 ] This may allow others to run alongside with the Flash. Barry did this with Wallace West by "locking" him in with his speed, granting him the boost needed to move at Barry's speed. Speed Steal : Barry admits that he can steal speed from others, but he needs to be in close range in order to do it. [ 199 ] [ 214 ] When infected by the Negative Speed Force, Barry stole all of Reverse-Flash's speed. [ 215 ]
Time Acceleration : During one of his battles with Professor Zoom, Barry realized that he can use the Speed Force to move time forward, allowing him to speed up the flow of time. By doing this, Barry was able to negate Zoom's power to slow time. In this instance, this power caused Barry's lightning to turn white. [ 157 ] In a battle with the Turtle, Barry used the Speed Force to connect with every living being on the planet, in order to speed up time a few seconds into the future and bring everyone else with him, except for the Turtle. [ 120 ]
Time Travel : Barry can use his speed to travel throughout the time stream. [ 39 ] [ 42 ] While originally needing the Cosmic Treadmill to achieve this, [ 60 ] [ 216 ] Barry eventually learned to time travel on his own. [ 42 ] [ 215 ] Barry has also raced along the borders of hypertime , the part of the time stream where overarching and interconnected web of timelines and realities exist. [ 217 ] [ 218 ] Because of Barry's ability to travel through time, he has the power to potentially alter the timeline, as he had previously changed it on his own power, during the Flashpoint. [ 212 ] [ 216 ]
Negative Speed Force Conduit : After being trapped in the Negative Speed Force (the natural antithesis of the positive Speed Force) by Eobard Thawne, Barry gained a connection to it due to being exposed to its energies. This connection caused Barry's lightning to turn black and red (later black and purple). [ 155 ] It would appear that he gained many of the Negative Speed Force abilities that Thawne possessed as well. Due to the Negative Speed Force corrupting his positive Speed Force energy, Barry is a lot more aggressive, seemingly less concerned about collateral damage. [ 215 ] He also seems to lack of control of the Negative Speed Force and always feels sore and exhausted after using its energy. [ 219 ] Superhuman Speed : While connected to the Negative Speed Force, Barry is capable of moving at vast superhuman speeds. His immense speeds allows him to keep up and rivaling the Reverse-Flash's speed while continuing to fight with him. [ 215 ] Superhuman Reflexes : Barry's reaction time is augmented to superhuman levels. [ 215 ] Superhuman Agility : Barry's agility, balance, and bodily coordination are enhanced to superhuman levels. This allows him to easily maneuver and leap far distances while moving at superhuman speed. [ 215 ] Electrokinesis : While connected to the Negative Speed Force, Barry generates destructive, dark lightning, that he can project as bolts from his hands. The lightning can also cause things to explode on contact. [ 219 ] Electro-Blast [ 219 ] [ 220 ] Negative Speed Force Aura : Similar to the positive Speed Force, While Barry is connected to the Negative Speed Force, his entire body is protected by a field of kinetic absorbent energy that protects him from the negative effects of moving at super-speed. When shot at, the Negative Speed Force aura incinerated the bullets before they could hit Barry. [ 219 ] Disintegration [ 219 ] Explosion Inducement : Every time Barry is dealt damage, his Negative Speed Force Aura builds up until it releases a large explosion. [ 215 ] Speed Steal : Barry stole all of the speed from Reverse-Flash at one point, during their battle. [ 215 ] Time-Travel : Barry was also able to freely time-travel through his own power, unaided by the cosmic treadmill, while connected to the Negative Speed Force. However, in a calm state, he can revert back to his normal state, and the red/purple of his lightning becomes more pronounced than the black. He was capable of creating his own alloy for the conception of his Flash Ring , along with creating a new element known as Lighzinium. [ 232 ] Barry has shown smart enough to outwit Dr. Alchemy, who possessed the combined knowledge and experience of previous owners who also claimed the title of Dr. Alchemy. [ 233 ]
Hand-to-Hand Combat (Advanced) : Due to his police training, [ 234 ] and training with the Justice League throughout the years, Barry became a highly skilled combatant, capable of utilizing his speed to his advantage in combat. Barry has honed his skills to the point that he can incorporate martial arts techniques into his fighting style. [ 229 ]
Indomitable Will : Barry possesses enough willpower to operate a Green Lantern Ring. [ 184 ]
Investigation : [ 235 ] Barry is a master detective, to the point that even Batman couldn't tell who was the better detective between the two of them. [ 236 ] Superman has stated that Barry is one of the best CSIs and Detectives in the world. [ 237 ] He can easily start to paint a picture of a crime scene before even running any tests. [ 60 ] He managed to deduce the location of several missing children in a child abduction case. Weaknesses
Power Instability : According to Nightwing , the Flash needs room to operate while in a hand-to-hand battle. When an opponent gets in close, Barry's blows are so fast, they could start to land on his own body. [ 250 ] [ 251 ]
Vulnerability to Dimensional Bursts : Amanda Waller stated that the Speed Force which fuel Barry Allen's powers can be disrupted by a potent enough extradimensional energy burst. She selected Vibe as a member of the Counter League Task Force to oppose the Justice League to work against the Flash, as Vibe's powers could disrupt his connection to the force in various ways. During one of their bouts, Barry permanently lost some of his speed due to Vibe's attack.
Vulnerability to Extreme Temperatures : If Barry is shot, hit, or falls for a trap that includes extreme temperatures of hot or cold. It can affect his durability and/or nullify his Speed Force abilities. [ 252 ] [ 253 ]
Vulnerability to Heat
Vulnerability to Cold
Vulnerability to EMP : If Barry becomes trapped in containment cell that involves an electromagnetic pulse, he will be unable to vibrate out to escape. [ 187 ]
Negative Speed Force Sickness : While infected with the Negative Speed Force, Barry was commonly nauseous and exhausted whenever he stopped using his powers, forcing him to use them sparingly. His ability to heal had also slowed significantly. It was revealed by Meena Dhawan that Barry was dying due to the Negative Speed Force conflicting with his positive. Fortunately, Barry was cured by Dhawan stealing his connection to the Negative Speed Force.
Power Instability : Also, while he was infected with the Negative Speed Force, Barry had a tough time controlling his new powers. His lightning, as well as powerful shockwaves produced by his slipstreams, caused widespread destruction. Barry also caused whatever he was phasing through to explode. However, when training with Kid Flash, his Negative Speed Force aura was calm, due to Wallace's unique Speed Force connection balancing his out.

Notes
Barry Allen was created by Robert Kanigher , John Broome , and Carmine Infantino , first appearing  in Showcase #4 . However, Barry Allen first appeared as part of Prime Earth continuity in Flashpoint (Volume 2) #5 by Geoff Johns and Andy Kubert .
Flash (Barry Allen) appears as The Flash (Prime) a playable character in the Infinite Crisis video game.
Trivia
Barry was the first person to travel to another universe in the multiverse, when he traveled between Earth-One and Earth-Two. [ 154 ]
Flash has admitted to John Stewart that in his free time, Barry has traveled the Multiverse more than once, along with saving a few universes during his adventures. [ 254 ]
Barry was named after his grandfather. [ 255 ] [ 57 ]
Santa Claus believes he's faster than the Flash. [ 256 ]
According to Aquaman, Barry can hit a hundred times a second, which Barry confirmed when he threatened Batman. [ 257 ] [ 258 ]
Batman finds Barry to be humble. [ 259 ]
A "shadow god" defines Barry as a god of speed. [ 260 ]
The Riddler defines Barry as the most powerful hero on Earth. [ 261 ]
Batman believes that Barry could teach him a thing or two. [ 262 ]
Barry's birthday is May 13th. [ 263 ]
Flash has a pet tortoise that has super speed. [ 264 ]
Frankenstein holds Barry in high regard and views him as a warrior. [ 195 ] [ 265 ]
John Constantine finds Barry to be a huge threat that not even the Justice League have realized, and has prepared a way to subdue him. Ironically though, John does find the Flash useful. [ 266 ] [ 267 ]
Every year during Christmas time, Flash and the Rogues put their issues aside as Barry delivers presents to children all over Central City. [ 268 ]
Every year, Barry participates in The Speedster Games, an event that lasts an entire minute. He shares the title of being the second fastest Flash and being in the multiverse alongside Mercury Flash . [ 269 ]
The Spectre defines the Flash as an embodiment of Hope, while Wonder Woman sees Barry as the heart of their world who will lead them to a better future. [ 270 ]

This character is or was an incarnation of or an ally of The Flash , and a member of the Flash Family of speedsters. This template will automatically categorize articles that include it into the " Flash Family members " category.
This character has been a member of the Justice League of America , or simply the Justice League in any of its various incarnations, sworn by a duty to act as guardians of America and the world by using their skills and/or superpowers to protect Earth from the clutches of both interstellar and domestic threats. This template will categorize articles that include it into the " Justice League of America members " category.

Barbara Gordon (Prime Earth)
Batgirl Mainstream Universe‎‎ , 2011‎ -present Gallery Real Name Barbara Joan Gordon [ 1 ] Main Alias Batgirl Other Aliases Oracle , [ 2 ] Bluebelle , Amy Beddoes, Knute Brody [ 3 ] Relatives James Gordon (father) Barbara Eileen Gordon (mother) James Gordon, Jr. (brother) Affiliation Batman Family , Batgirls , Birds of Prey , Justice League Unlimited · Formerly Batman Incorporated , Leviathan , Justice League United Base Of Operations Gotham City Status Alignment Good Identity Secret Identity Citizenship American Marital Status Single Occupation Vigilante , Businesswoman Characteristics Gender Female Height 5' 9" Weight 135 lbs (61 kg) Eyes Green Hair Red Origin Universe Prime Earth Creators Julius Schwartz · Gardner Fox · Carmine Infantino First Appearance Flashpoint Vol 2  #5 ( October, 2011 )

Barbara Gordon is both the Gotham City vigilante known as Batgirl and the elite computer hacker known as the Oracle . She is the daughter of Commissioner James Gordon and Barbara Eileen Gordon and the older sister of James Gordon Jr. .

History
Early Life and Career
Batgirl back in action
Barbara Eileen Gordon left her family when her daughter was young. Batman debuted. This inspired young Barbara to become Batgirl . Soon, she began working with Batman and his teenage partner, Robin . [ 4 ] She attended Burnside College , where she briefly dated Charles Dante . After a period of time as Batgirl, Barbara retreated from her role. Shortly after, she was shot in the spine by the Joker . [ 5 ]
While in physical therapy following her injury, she met Francine Charles ; they befriended one another after Barbara taught Francine some katas that aided with her therapeutic exercizes. [ 6 ]
Looking for other ways to fight, Barbara became a hacker and information broker, donned the identity of the Oracle and founded the Birds of Prey . [ 2 ] Years later, her father found a clinic where Barbara's condition could be mitigated. Barbara underwent surgery and received a cybernetic implant on her neck's nape. She fully recovered and returned to her position as Batgirl. [ 7 ]
The New 52
The Miraculous Killer
Main article: Batgirl: The Darkest Reflection
Batgirl defeating the Mirror
Shortly after her return as Batgirl, Barbara moved in to an apartment owned by Alysia Yeoh and came into contact with a villain calling himself the Mirror . The Mirror was attempting to kill a criminal who had survived a near-death situation the previous night. [ 8 ] After killing the criminal, the Mirror fled to a graveyard where Batgirl intercepted him. She was beaten by the Mirror before the cops arrived and the murderer fled. [ 9 ]
While researching into the Mirror, Barbara discovered that he was an ex-soldier whose family had died in a car crash, but he had miraculously survived. After Batgirl located his hideout, a screen activated and the Mirror told Batgirl that, due to his family's deaths, he took up the mantle of the Mirror. His aim was to kill all those who had survived due to a "miracle", as he saw them as curses instead of blessings. [ 9 ] He then told her of his next targets and she rushed to save them; however, she was too late, as one target was blown up with a train. [ 10 ] Batgirl then went on to lure the Mirror to an amusement park where she was finally able to end the killer's reign of terror. After defeating the Mirror, Barbara's mother showed up on her door step for the first time in years. [ 11 ]
338
Main article: Batgirl: The Darkest Reflection
One night while patrolling the city, Barbara came across a family of gangsters who were supposed to be laying low committing an act of terrorism. Upon investigating, Batgirl discovered all four of the men chanting "338", then the father killed his three sons and attempted to commit suicide. Batgirl was then attacked by a woman calling herself Gretel , who fled the scene almost immediately after. Gretel then attacked Bruce Wayne and, when Batgirl tried to intercept, Gretel put Bruce under her spell, causing him to chant "338" and attack Batgirl. [ 12 ] She was eventually able to get through to Wayne and free him from the spell; however, Gretel was gone. Upon returning home, she discovered that Gretel was a journalist who had been shot in the head by a 38. caliber bullet when she was investigating a crimelord. Upon surviving the gun shot she discovered she could control men. Gretel then made another attempt on Wayne's life, but was stopped by Batgirl and Batman before being sent to Arkham Asylum . [ 13 ]
The Weasel
Main article: Batgirl: Knightfall Descends
While on patrol, Batgirl came across a hostage situation at a gala. She fought against the metahuman villain Grotesque until he and his henchmen were forced to flee. Upon entering the sewer she came across the two henchmen, taking off the mask of one of them, under it she found a terror from her past - Danny "The Weasel" Weaver - one of the Joker's thugs on the night he took her legs. [ 14 ] Batgirl then let him go for reasons she could not explain. Upon returning to her apartment, her mother told her that the reason she left was because James Jr. had killed the family cat and told her that if she did not leave, Barbara would be next. Upon tracking Grotesque to his lair, she was attacked by the villain, who had the upper hand; however, Weaver shot at Grotesque long enough so Batgirl could defeat him, and after taking a mortal wound from Grotesque, the Weasel died. [ 15 ]
The Birds of Prey
Batgirl assisted the Birds of Prey on a mission when they went after the super-villain Choke . [ 16 ] She helped them take down Choke's sleeper agents known as the Cleaners . [ 17 ] They tracked down their leader, a psychic named Trevor Cahill , and Batgirl was finally able to reconnect with the Black Canary as close friends. [ 18 ]
Night of the Owls
Main article: Batman: Night of the Owls
Batgirl taking on a Talon
While on patrol Batgirl witnessed an explosion - she went to help the survivors but was attacked by a figure in an owl costume. The figure easily defeated Batgirl but instead of finishing her off she fled the scene, leaving behind a piece of paper. Upon examining the paper Batgirl discovered that it contained a date in kanji - November 1944 - as well as a balloon bomb. Barbara realized that the bomb and the paper was from World War II, when Japan sent balloon bombs across the ocean in hopes they would go to America and explode. Barbara then rushed to GCPD Headquarters as several balloon bombs had gone off there. At that moment a message was sent out by Alfred which said the Court of Owls - a secret society - had sent out their Talons to assassinate high profile targets who opposed them, and one such was Jim Gordon. Batgirl was able to intercept and defeat the Talon before it could reach its target. [ 19 ]
Later on in the night Batgirl travelled to assist the Birds of Prey with another Talon . However this Talon was a lot more skilled and sent the Birds of Prey on the retreat. The team then attempted to lock him in a freezer, as cold was the Talons' weakness. However he overpowered all of the Birds until Poison Ivy arrived and locked him and herself in the freezer - defeating him in the process. [ 20 ]
Knightfall Emerges
Main article: Batgirl: Knightfall Descends
Shortly after the Night of the Owls, Batgirl was taking down a group of car thieves at a charity gala run by billionaire Charise Carnes when one of the car thieves, Ricky, was caught in a bear trap. The gala security then took over the situation. When she was patrolling later that night she saw the gala security in costumes about to drop Ricky off a roof. The leader explained they are a group called the Disgraced who deliver punishment to criminals and kill them afterwards. The leader then dropped Ricky off the building and as Batgirl went to rescue him she was attacked by a flying woman named Kartharsis . Upon dropping her she said "Knightfall has risen" and that they would eradicate crime in Gotham. Batgirl was then surrounded by the Disgraced, headed up by their boss Knightfall . [ 21 ] She deduced that Knightfall was Charise Carnes as she was their boss at the gala. She was overpowered by the vigilantes but was saved by Detective McKenna and they fled the area. [ 22 ]
Batgirl vs. Batwoman
McKenna explained that Charise Carnes was forced to watch her family being butchered for three hours which left her mentally scarred. She was then found guilty of the murders and sent to Arkham. There, she was involved in another massacre, this time of Arkham guards. When she got out of Arkham she declared a deadly war on criminals and recruited many police officers to her cause. [ 22 ] Batgirl and Detective McKenna were then attacked by Batwoman , who was attempting to have McKenna arrested for corruption. [ 23 ] After convincing Batwoman to help them, the group travelled to Knightfall's base where she had Ricky hostage. Batgirl, Batwoman and McKenna were able to take down the Disgraced and Knightfall. McKenna went on to provide proof of Knightfall's crimes, however the villain was able to evade capture. [ 24 ]
The Return of Talon
Batgirl was investigating the burning down of many buildings by the homeless. Her investigation led her to a member of the Court of Owls. Upon spying on the meeting he was having with Catwoman , she noticed that the Talon from the G.C.P.D. Building was present. Catwoman had delivered the Talon to the Court from Blackgate Penitentiary but was having some ethical issues with the job. Batgirl then rushed into the building to save Catwoman from the Talon and her brethren. The Pair were outmatched by the four enhanced warriors until Batgirl was able to convince the Talon to change allegiance and change sides. The triplet then took down the Talons and the Court member killed himself. Catwoman then distracted the authorities while Batgirl brought the Talon - Mary - to safety. [ 25 ]
An Estranged Marriage
Main article: Batman: Death of the Family
While Barbara was on the phone to her mother, she went silent. Determined to find out what happened, she was contacted by who she thought was the Joker. The door then burst down and three of the Joker's thugs came in.
Batgirl's horrific wedding
After dropping them (much to Alysia's shock) she was given the location of her mother by the would-be Joker who revealed that he knew Barbara was Batgirl. [ 26 ] She then travelled to the location that the Joker informed her of and found her mother bound. It was at this time that Barbara realised the person on the phone wasn't the Joker as he revealed himself to be her brother, James Jr.,-escaped from Arkham. The Joker then revealed the severed ring finger of Barbara's mother and proposed with it. [ 26 ] After being forced to accept the proposal by the Joker she was given another location to be at within an allotted time. [ 27 ]
After rendezvousing with Batman and the Robins Batman informed them that the Joker had been gone for a year but had come back and slaughtered 19 police officers; he had then proceeded to commit crimes that mirrored several of his early crimes. He had also kidnapped Alfred and was torturing him, and had had his own face cut off by the Dollmaker as a calling card for Batman. [ 28 ] After fanning out to look for the Joker she received a message from the Red Robin that the Joker had kidnapped him and that she should advise the Teen Titans on where to look. [ 29 ] After doing that, Batgirl travelled to the church that the Joker had instructed her to go to and he revealed his plan - to kill all of Batman's allies who were making him soft and weak. [ 30 ] She was about to be killed when James Jr. walked in with a grenade, telling her that their mother was free. This tipped the scales, allowing Batgirl to beat the Joker; she was about to kill him when James Jr. knocked her out, as he wanted her out the picture for his plans. [ 30 ] When she woke up, she was at a dinner table with Alfred and the Robins. There, the Joker tried to convince Batman to give up on his family; not convinced, Batman broke free and defeated the Joker - seemingly killing him. [ 31 ]
James Jr.'s Return
Main article: Batgirl: Batgirl Wanted!
In the aftermath of the Joker's return, Barbara was helping the authorities apprehend many of the Joker's thugs. During this point she was contacted by James Jr., who said that he would enact his plans soon. While searching for several henchmen, Batgirl came into contact with the flame-based villain the Firebug . [ 32 ] After her encounter with the Firebug, she was informed that Robin had died, and decided to track down the Firebug instead of her brother. After locating the Firebug, she was able to take down the villain. Barbara's mother then told Barbara that James Jr. wanted her to come to the pier alone or he would kill Barbara. [ 33 ] Batgirl then followed her mother to the pier. After a brief struggle with her brother, he told her that he killed because of Barbara and how perfect she was. He then attacked the pair once more, which forced Barbara to fling him off the pier to his seeming death; however, Commissioner Gordon witnessed this and blamed Batgirl for his son's death. [ 34 ]
Deadline
Main article: Batgirl: Deadline
This section of the article does not provide a complete profile of the subject. You can help out by providing additional information, expanding on the subject matter in order to bring this article to a higher standard of quality.
Batgirl of Burnside
Main article: Batgirl: Batgirl of Burnside
After successfully taking down Knightfall, Barbara was emotionally worn-out and in need of a change of scenery. Barbara moved to Burnside , one of the wards of Gotham City, and started operating there. She also returned to her alma mater, Burnside University , and began post-graduate studies, hoping to use some of the algorithms she developed as the Oracle as part of her thesis. [ 35 ]
Although she became unexpectedly popular quickly, Barbara had to deal with someone sending villains after her and looking to ruin her reputation. Eventually, Barbara discovered her mysterious enemy was an A.I. gone mad that she had herself created. [ 36 ] Batgirl managed to shut it down before it brought about a bloodbath. [ 37 ]
Family Business

DC Rebirth
Mindfields
Main article: Batgirl: Mindfields
Barbara started getting memory lapses and nightmares created by a villain called Fugue whom she had put away some time ago. Using mind-scanning technology, Fugue had learned all of Batgirl's secrets and mind-controlled several more villains into planting bombs across Burnside, hoping to blame it on Batgirl. [ 38 ] Batgirl retaliated by recruiting several fellow heroines to stop the villains and she successfully took Fugue down. [ 39 ]
In the meantime, Barbara started up her own green energy business, although she needed to step down from day-to-day management. [ 40 ]
Beyond Burnside
Main article: Batgirl: Beyond Burnside
After defeating Fugue, Barbara decided to take a vacation to Japan. However this turned to out to be anything but relaxing when she ran into Kai, an old acquaintance of hers [ 41 ] who had got himself into trouble with several Asian criminal gangs. [ 42 ] Batgirl saved him, but she was not thrilled with Kai using her civilian identity to protect himself, and told him to never bother "Barbara" again before returning to Gotham. [ 43 ]
The Return of the Birds of Prey
Barbara found out someone was using her old "Oracle" identity and enlisted the aid of the Black Canary and the Huntress to hunt that person down.
Son of Penguin
Main article: Batgirl: Son of Penguin
Back in Burnside, Batgirl discovered that the Penguin 's bastard son, Ethan , was setting up shop in the town, [ 44 ] flooding Burnside with nonsensical mobile apps as part of a plan to take over the place and destroy his father. [ 45 ] In spite of his techno-suit, he was not a match for Batgirl. [ 46 ]
The Phantom Zone
Main article: Supergirl: Escape from the Phantom Zone
Batgirl and Supergirl
Tracking down a villain led Batgirl to National City where she met Supergirl . The younger hero asked Barbara's help to break into a Cadmus black site and rescue an imprisoned telepath named Gayle Marsh (Psi) . Barbara and Kara teamed up to free Gayle, but Gayle used Supergirl to enter the Phantom Zone . Both heroines managed to escape, but they agreed that the story was not over. [ 47 ]
Several days later, Barbara attended a clean energy expo in National City sponsored by TychoTech, a firm that used Kryptonian technology stolen from the D.E.O. to create a device powered by energy siphoned from the Phantom Zone . During the unveiling, Barbara met Supergirl again, and the Girl of Steel recognized her right away. Magog attacked Supergirl during the event and their battle broke the device down. Both Batgirl and Supergirl were thrown into the Zone. [ 48 ] There they were captured by Xa-Du , the Phantom Zone's first inmate. Xa-Du had captured Psi, intending to coerce her into opening a rift to escape from the Zone, but she encased herself in a psionic bubble. Therefore, Xa-Du was boiling other Phantom Zoners over and turning their souls into fuel for his armor in order to make himself powerful enough to break Psi's bubble. [ 49 ] Batgirl and Supergirl managed to escape and, while Supergirl reached Psi out, Batgirl engaged Xa-Du. Both girls managed to defeat the villain and Psi sent them back home. After their adventure, Barbara and Kara praised each other, and Barbara assured Kara that she could ask her help whenever she needed her. [ 50 ]
The Aqua Ghost
Batgirl went to investigate a supposedly haunted swimming pool. According to the workers, an ethereal being would show up in the swimming pool but not harm anyone, and once the people left the pool it would disappear. Barbara went to get the water tested, but after the results came back normal she was redirected to Professor Radden. Before meeting with him, she researched him and discovered his theory on Hydroportation - as well as the fact that one of his students went missing around the same time that he published his papers. Upon investigating the missing student's apartment, she discovered that the student had, in fact, come up with the theory. Batgirl then deduced that Radden had used his student's theory against her by trapping her in an alternate dimension, and then took credit for her work. She then realized that the student was the ethereal being and she was trying to cross over but could not because her anchors, the pool's visitors, always left before she could materialize. Batgirl then gathered a group of people and brought the student back. [ 51 ]
The Red Queen
Main article: Batgirl: Summer of Lies
Batgirl and Nightwing both received a message luring them to the same spot. They were ambushed by two identically dressed women, who delivered a threatening message to the heroes before committing suicide. Batgirl and Nightwing believed that they strongly resembled a woman named Ainsley Wells whom Barbara had been friends with while she was at high school. Years ago, Batgirl and Robin discovered Ainsley was creating a nanotech drug which she sold to the Mad Hatter in order to fuel her own drug addiction. Ainsley ended up suffering from an overdose and fell out of contact with Barbara.
Batgirl and Nightwing face the Red Queen
Batgirl and Nightwing suspected the Mad Hatter was responsible, but discovered that he was in the hospital and had not ordered the attack against them. The Mad Hatter awoke in a crazed state, warning the heroes of someone called the " Red Queen ". [ 52 ] In the hospital, Batgirl discovered a doctor who appeared to have gone berserk. They later discovered that nanobots were responsible for her behavior. [ 53 ] Batgirl and Nightwing discovered that Ainsley died homeless, and they deduced that the Red Queen was her sister, Edith , who was using the drug that Ainsley had developed for her own malicious purposes. [ 54 ]
Batgirl and Nightwing tracked down the Red Queen, who infected Nightwing with the nanobot drug. The Red Queen instructed him to kill Batgirl, blaming her for failing to save her sister from death. Batgirl was able to restore Nightwing's sanity using her electromagnets and her neural implant, temporarily paralyzing her legs in the process. Together, the duo managed to defeat the Red Queen and she was apprehended. Nightwing helped Batgirl restore her mobility before the two heroes went their separate ways. [ 55 ]
Further Burnside Adventures
Several months later, Batgirl had to stop Harley Quinn 's Christmas rampage when the villain decided to poison a whole Christmas party. [ 56 ]
A while afterwards, a sudden blizzard left Burnside covered with snow. When the Penguin rushed into offering his assistance to solve the crisis, Batgirl found his sudden altruism suspicious and decided to investigate why the Weather Administration had not foreseen the blizzard. Batgirl found someone had sabotaged the local weather station and created a false trail to get her out of Burnside. [ 57 ]
Batgirl came back to Burnside and found out that Blacksun had returned and stolen a mind-control device from a lab. Batgirl guessed Blacksun was now working for his father, and she soon discovered that the Penguin intended to use the stolen device to boost his future election campaign. Batgirl managed to stop both Cobblepots and turned them over to the police. [ 58 ]
Shortly after, as she was facing a domestic abuser, Batgirl was hit by a hypnotic beam which trapped her mind into a loop. [ 59 ] Batgirl looked for ways to break her mind out of the loop, finally realizing she had to act in completely unexpected ways to catch her own brain off-guard. Batgirl broke free, woke up and took the abuser down. [ 60 ]
The Brightest Star in Heaven
Batgirl vs. James Jr.
As investigating a cluster of similar murders, Batgirl noticed the murderer's modus operandi reminded her of her brother. Batgirl checked and found out that James Jr. remained behind bars, but her brother hinted that those deaths had been committed by some fan of his. James offered his fan mail in return for Barbara coming back and visiting sometimes.
Barbara did not intend to return until she tracked the murderer down and learned that the woman was not a fan, but rather her brother's disciple. James Jr. had reached out to her in order to instruct her and goad her into a confrontation with Batgirl. Barbara agreed to visit her brother occasionally, resigning herself to the idea that she was doomed to get tangled with her brother forever, and ignoring James' scheming to corrupt her. [ 61 ]
Art of the Crime
Batgirl started investigating a number of gruesome murders committed by her old enemy Grotesque, who had escaped from Blackgate and was no longer satisfied with merely stealing art. Batgirl caught him right after he killed an elderly couple, but he escaped and Batgirl chased after him. [ 62 ]
Back in Batgirl's original costume
Although Batgirl caught up with Grotesque, his electrical batons damaged her neural implant during their fight. Despite being dazed and barely able to walk, Batgirl chased him all the way to a safe house. However she soon suffered from a sequence of strange visions and suddenly found herself falling off the building. Batgirl managed to save herself, but she barely remembered what she had seen in Grotesque's safe house, and Grotesque torched the place down and ran away before she had time to return. Batgirl knew he was planning something big, though, so she sneaked into the GCPD Headquarters and hacked into their database to gather information. She was greeting her father when she collapsed all of a sudden. [ 63 ]
Barbara was taken to Gotham General Hospital , where she was told that they needed to replace her implant. Her father implored her to come back to his house and rest while waiting for the surgery. Batgirl pretended to agree, but as soon as she went up to her old bedroom, she pored over the data copied from the GCPD . Barbara learned the disturbing fact that Detective Evans, the officer assigned to the case, had stopped looking for Grotesque, and she got a list of safe houses to look around.
Despite risking permanent brain or physical injury, Batgirl headed out to stop her mass-murdering enemy. She discovered Phillipe Rianne, the original Grotesque, had been murdered a while ago. Batgirl confronted the new Grotesque and found out that he was someone who hated Gotham's wealthy families, so he was murdering them and selling their art collections while the police blamed, and looked for, his predecessor. Batgirl managed to take him down, but when she was calling the police she suffered another seizure. When she woke up, she found the police had come and Detective Evans was blaming Phillipe Rianne's murder on her. [ 64 ]
Batgirl managed to escape and go back home. After further investigation, she deduced Grotesque's real identity was Detective Evan Douglas, who was working for Wyrm . He had replaced the Gotham Museum of Antiquities ' pieces with fakes and, in order to cover up his crime, he intended to blow the museum up during an exhibit together with all of the attendants. [ 65 ]
Batgirl sneaked into the museum and fought Grotesque and Wyrm's Terminals, but Grotesque set the bombs off. However, when the Terminals refused to follow his orders to evacuate the civilians, Batgirl wrestled him to the ground and gave him a choice between dying together with everyone else or stopping being Wyrm's puppet and help her save people. Grotesque helps her destroy the bomb, but he is killed off by Wyrm.
Three days later, Barbara underwent surgery and her chip was successfully repaired. [ 66 ]
Old Enemies
Hunted by Cormorant
Batgirl was watching over a rally organized by Luciana Alejo, a politician who was running for Congress and focusing her campaign on the GCPD 's corruption. When a group of radicals attempted to sabotage the rally, Batgirl drove them away. Althought she could not stop them, she found out that their leader was ex-Commissioner Jason Bard , who framed her father for murder and whom she fought once. Guessing that Bard must be working for Alejo's rival, Branson Moore, she decided to volunteer for Alejo in order to protect her from Bard. However, she discovered that Jason Bard was working for Alejo. Bard claimed that he was trying to protect Alejo, and that Moore was not only behind the riot at her rally, but also had hired an assassin named Cormorant . [ 67 ]
After foiling an assassination attempt during a fundraiser, Batgirl decided to interrogate Branson Moore, but he had been assaulted by Cormorant, too. Batgirl found out Cormorant was working for someone who wanted to prevent Alejo and Moore's joint deal to close Blackgate Penitentiary . Cormorant had succeeded in scaring Moore, but Alejo refused to bail out. Against Barbara and Jason's warnings, Alejo scheduled a televised interview, refusing to request police protection. [ 68 ]
In spite of Bard's security and Batgirl's surveillance, Cormorant managed to sneak into the TV studio and tried to fulfill his contract. Batgirl engaged him, but Cormorant managed to take Alejo hostage. Batgirl was trying to talk him down when Jason Bard gunned Cormorant down. Despite Jason Bard's claims he had reformed and there was no other way to save Alejo, Batgirl decided someone who is able to kill so casually could not be trusted. [ 69 ]
Doomsday Clock
Main article: Doomsday Clock Vol 1
After Superman was framed and rendered comatose, Batgirl and most of the Batman Family joined the group of heroes heading towards Mars to confront their mysterious enemy. The heroes met and engaged Doctor Manhattan , but they were easily defeated. [ 70 ]
Dark Knights: Death Metal

The Joker War
This section of the article does not provide a complete profile of the subject. You can help out by providing additional information, expanding on the subject matter in order to bring this article to a higher standard of quality.
Infinite Frontier
Leaping into the Light
At some point after the Joker War, Barbara traveled to Blüdhaven to give Dick Grayson what Alfred had left him in his will. She gave Dick the contents of Alfred's will: several billion dollars. [ 71 ] After Dick's wallet was stolen and he saw the injustices going on in the city, he told Barbara that he would be the city's safety net. [ 72 ] Before Barbara could leave Blüdhaven, she had to serve as Dick's alibi when he was accused of murder by the Blüdhaven police. She later aided Dick and Tim Drake in investigating the homeless camp, where Dick came face-to-face with Heartless. [ 73 ]
After Dick awakened from a concussion suffered at the hands of Heartless, she showed him that Melinda Zuko had become the mayor of Blüdhaven. Despite Barbara's commands to rest, Dick went to confront Melinda. [ 74 ] After Dick came to, he quickly contacted Barbara to call off the rescue mission launched by several super-heroes. She did so, and told him not to trust Melinda. [ 75 ] After Dick escaped the Blockbuster, Barbara cared for Dick as he slept for two days. Before Dick went to meet the press regarding the creation of the Alfred Pennyworth Foundation, he thanked her for everything and they shared a kiss. [ 76 ]
Urban Legends

The Cowardly Lot
This section of the article does not provide a complete profile of the subject. You can help out by providing additional information, expanding on the subject matter in order to bring this article to a higher standard of quality.
Fear State
Batgirl returns to take on the Magistrate
As the Magistrate began to take over the airwaves of Gotham, Barbara decided to send a message via the Gotham City Emergency Broadcast System, only for her systems to be hacked and for the messages to be hijacked and spread a message of fear to the city and that Batman is dead. [ 77 ] Batman later arrived at the Clock Tower; there, Barbara filled Batman in on what had happened while he was imprisoned by the Scarecrow. Batman had her connect him to the Ghost-Maker so they could use his communications system. [ 78 ] Later, Nightwing arrived in Gotham after being set up by the false Oracle. Frustrated, Barbara decided to suit up in order to fight on the front lines, as she had been locked out of the system. [ 79 ]
After destroying her equipment to prevent the Seer from using it against her, she and Dick departed and went to Oracle 2, a back-up Barbara had built. Once there, they defeated the Magistrate soldiers and entered the building. There, they were exposed to fear toxin and Barbara saw Dick get shot in the head and attacked the assailant. Thankfully, Tim was able to save them, but they learned from the Seer that she had rigged the Clock Tower to explode, but only after posing as Oracle and having Cassandra and Stephanie meet at the Clock Tower. Barbara watched in horror as the Clock Tower exploded. [ 80 ] Babs, Tim, and Dick were relieved to find out Cass and Steph had escaped the explosion beforehand.
Together, they came up with a plan to board Skybase-01, where the Seer and Simon Saint where hiding. Babs and Dick failed to find the Seer, who had plotted a course for the base to crash into Gotham, but they did take down Saint and turn him into police custody after Babs altered the base's flight path into the harbor. On the shore, Babs pondered her next move against the Seer. [ 81 ]
Shortly after the events of Fear State , Babs had Cass and Steph stay at the Holmes hotel while she tried to figure who or what the Seer is and found them a loft to move into while she crashed at Dick's place. Babs returned to take Cass and Steph to their new warehouse loft, all the while being watched by the Seer. [ 82 ]
Get Grayson
After discovering a group of hitmen had dognapped Haley to try to lure Dick out into the open in order to collect the price on his head, Barbara helped Dick get Haley back both as Batgirl and the Oracle. [ 83 ] Later, Babs contacted the Titans in order to help protect Dick from several hitmen at a groundbreaking event. Babs oversaw their deployment and provided them with intelligence and direction, leading to a foiled assassination attempt. [ 84 ]
Barbara again helped save Dick when she informed him that the Blockbuster had sent a military drone to attack his apartment building. She was then later kidnapped by agents of the Blockbuster in an effort to force Dick out into the open. She was able to inform Dick and Wally West of her predicament and, not wanting to raise suspicions by easily escaping and wanting to find out who was in charge, she told Dick and Wally to wait to rescue her. They did so and confronted the KGBeast. [ 85 ]
After Dick and Wally took care of the KGBeast, they met together to share what they had learned. Dick's sister contacted him, telling him that the person that sent the KGBeast was La Agente Funebre, an assassin thought to be a myth. Barbara was able to track down the location of the last communication to Costa Rica, and Dick went to confront La Agente Funebre. [ 86 ]
The Battle for Blüdhaven's Heart
After Barbara attended the opening of Haven with Dick and Bruce, she assisted Dick in identifying BPD officers disguised as looters, [ 87 ] and later unveiled their identities on television, destroying Commissioner MacClean's reputation and forcing his resignation, which led to Maggie Sawyer becoming the BPD's new Police Commissioner. [ 88 ] [ 89 ] Shortly thereafter, Barbara assisted Dick and Melinda in tricking MacClean to flee with files containing evidence of the Blockbuster's crimes and the list of cops under his payroll, which were taken by Dick. [ 90 ]
After everything was in place, Barbara coordinated several super-hero attacks on the Blockbuster's criminal enterprises. This action led to the Blockbuster attacking Haven, which Barbara rushed to to assist Dick in his battle with the Blockbuster. [ 91 ] Barbara arrived with Batwoman and was able to disperse the Blockbuster's henchmen by showing them evidence of the Blockbuster's holdings in Blüdhaven's private prisons, in which criminals like the Electrocutioner spent time in. When the Blockbuster demanded that they help him flee after Dick defeated him, they refused and left. [ 92 ]
Barbara caught up to Dick, where he told her they could not be together since the Blockbuster discovered his identity and that it would be too dangerous for her. She laughed and responded as a super-hero that she was aware of the risks and was also willing to take them if it meant she could be with Dick, since it made her happy. They then shared a kiss. When Dick asked what they would do about the Blockbuster, she told him that they would cross that bridge when they got there. [ 93 ]

Throwing : Batgirl is accomplished at throwing Batarangs. [ 34 ]
Other Characteristics
Restricted Mobility : Barbara was paralyzed for three years after being shot by the Joker. However, she managed to overcome her paralysis with the help of groundbreaking medical treatment and returned to fighting crime. However, as a consequence of her long-term overuse of the neural implant in her brain, it has become strained, and resultingly her mobility varies from day to day, ranging from her peak ability to operate as Batgirl to being wheelchair-bound.
Neural Implant : Barbara had experimental surgery after her shooting. She has a neural implant at the base of her brain that connects to her lower spine, which bypasses the missing section of her spine and allows her to use her legs. If the implant is damaged or malfunctions, Barbara could become paralyzed and/or suffer brain damage.

Notes
Barbara Gordon was created by Gardner Fox , Carmine Infantino , and Julius Schwartz , first appearing  in Detective Comics #359 . However, Barbara Gordon first appeared as part of Prime Earth continuity in Batgirl (Volume 4) #1 by Gail Simone and Ardian Syaf .
Trivia
Barbara has worked for the Local Municipality's Code-Compliance Department/Code Enforcement for Gotham City. [ 101 ]
She also worked as an assistant to Congresswoman Luciana Alejo. [ 102 ]
Barbara was shot by the Joker when she was 17 years old. [ 103 ]
As of Batgirl (Volume 4) #35 , Barbara was 21 years old, though successive continuity changes may have rendered that null and void. [ 104 ] . After the Dark Knights: Death Metal event, Barbara is mentioned to be the same age as Cressida Clarke, who was mentioned to be 24 years old. [ 105 ]
Batgirl was briefly married to Nightwing , but their marriage was quickly annulled. [ 106 ]
Barbara's childhood address was 359 Dozier Terrace. [ 107 ] This is a reference to her co-creator, William Dozier , and her first appearance in Detective Comics #359 .

Batman (Bruce Wayne)

Batman is the superhero protector of Gotham City , a tortured, brooding vigilante dressed as a bat who fights against evil and strikes fear into the hearts of criminals everywhere. In his public identity, he is Bruce Wayne , a billionaire industrialist and notorious playboy. Although he has no superhuman abilities, he is one of the world's smartest men and greatest fighters. His physical prowess, technical ingenuity, and tactical thinking make him an incredibly dangerous opponent. He is also a founding member of the Justice League .

7.1 Footnotes
History
Early Life
Main article: Batman Origins
Bruce Wayne was born to wealthy physician Dr. Thomas Wayne and his wife Martha , who were themselves members of the prestigious Wayne and Kane families of Gotham City , respectively.
When he was three, Bruce's mother Martha was expecting a second child to be named Thomas Wayne, Jr. However, because of her intent to find a school for the underprivileged in Gotham, she was targeted by the manipulative Court of Owls , who arranged for her to have a car accident. She and Bruce survived, but the accident forced Martha into premature labor, and the baby was lost. [ 2 ]
While on vacation to forget about these events, the Wayne Family butler, Jarvis Pennyworth was killed by one of the Court of Owls' Talons. A letter he'd written to his son Alfred , warning him away from the beleaguered Wayne family, was never delivered. As such, Alfred—who had been an actor at the Globe Theatre at the time [ 3 ] and a military medic before that, traveled to Gotham City to take up his father's place, serving the Waynes as butler. [ 4 ]
The Waynes' murder
As he grew older, his family's reputation made Bruce restless, and he began sneaking out of school to visit Gotham City, where he wouldn't be so easily recognized. [ 5 ] On one such outing, when he was ten years old, he was picked up by Officer Jim Gordon and his partner on their patrol. En route back to the station , Bruce witnessed Jim accepting a trench coat as a bribe from a tailor—though neither realized it was a bribe at the time—but Bruce would remember it as an indicator of Jim's character.
After his parents picked Bruce up at the police station, the Waynes went to see The Mark of Zorro at the Monarch Theater . When the Waynes were walking home after the movie, a mugger named Joe Chill attempted to rob them at gunpoint, and panicked, shooting both Thomas and Martha dead. [ 6 ]
Later Childhood
Following his parents' deaths, Bruce attempted to commit suicide with a razor blade. However, just before he went through with it, he realized that this wasn't what his parents would want, and it was at that moment Bruce vowed to spend the rest of his life warring on crime. [ 7 ]
Bruce became obsessed with the search for meaning in the loss of his parents. He thought perhaps the mythical Court of Owls was responsible, but he never found anything to prove it. [ 8 ]
Shortly after their deaths, Bruce became obsessed with using toy guns and killing the man who murdered his parents. Because of this, Alfred sent Bruce to an Arkham boys' rehabilitation home upstate where he first met Harvey Dent . The boys became good friends but wouldn't realize their identities until years later. [ 9 ]
In his youth, Bruce attended Gotham Academy . It was there that he dated Julie Madison , but his psychological issues with his parents' deaths ultimately led to the end of their relationship. One day, he was asked by a professor to answer a problem involving a projectile being fired at a target. This triggered Bruce to answer the question by burning the answer on the professor's front yard. [ 10 ]
As a pre-teen, Bruce began getting into fights with a kid who was bullying Bruce's classmates. Alfred eventually grew tired of Bruce's desire to solve his problems through aggression and told Bruce act strategically, rather than with his fists. Bruce interpreted this by locking the bully in the school boiler room and giving him poison ivy until the boy eventually changed schools. [ 11 ] Bruce was later expelled from Gotham Academy and began attending Roxbury Fielding Academy. [ 12 ]
Troubled by grief, Bruce found that he couldn't function the way he was, so he hired a homeless man to pretend to be Alfred to approve of the paperwork so that Bruce could erase his memory with electroshock therapy, but chose not to go through with it, and to use his pain as a motivator. [ 13 ] At the age of 18, he used his relationship with Erin McKillen [ 14 ] —a daughter of the Irish mob, and with whom he attended Roxbury Academy [ 15 ] —to locate Joe Chill, and learned that he had simply needed the money, and there was no deeper meaning to his parents' deaths.
