[ 181 ] Afterwards, a mysterious man calling himself Starman had come to the Hall of Justice to warn the Justice League about the fate of the universe, [ 182 ] but his unstable energies began coursing all over Washington D.C. until Wonder Woman restrained him with her lasso. Once his power was stabilized, Starman told Superman and his friends the story of Perpetua . [ 183 ]
The Justice League, with assistance from Starman and the Green Lantern Corps, traveled to the Source Wall in the hopes of fixing it. To do that, they gathered the surviving Omega Titans and place them along the broken wall. However, their efforts were interrupted by the resurrected Brainiac, who had become a member of Luthor's new Legion of Doom. Brainiac sabotaged the Source Wall's healing process and stole Starman's powers, using them resurrect Perpetua, creator of the Multiverse and the cosmic entity sealed behind the Source Wall. With the Wall destroyed and their mission a failure, the Justice League returned home. [ 184 ]
The Justice League had to ask Mister Mxyzptlk to open a portal to the Sixth Dimension in the hopes of stopping the Legion of Doom and Perpetua. According to Mxyzptlk, Superman was the only one capable of surviving the trip to the Sixth Dimension, so the Man of Steel volunteered to make the trip alone until he could return home and inform the Justice League of his findings. Upon stepping out of the portal, however, Superman found himself trapped in a remote planet surrounded by darkness, with no stars to power him up. [ 185 ] Superman spent an unspecified amount of time trying to escape from the planet until he found himself face-to-face with an older Superman, [ 186 ] who revealed himself to be responsible for Clark's imprisonment. The older Superman easily defeated his younger counterpart in single combat and left him to spend the rest of his life alone in the deserted planet. [ 187 ] .
Even so, Superman refused to give into despair and continued his attempts to escape from the dark planet, using a remote star as his power source. Superman was ultimately able to escape from the planet but the star disappeared, leaving Superman isolated in the middle of dark space. [ 188 ] Fortunately, Superman reached a region of space illuminated by thousands of suns, which revitalized Superman and allowed him to reach the Sixth Dimension, where the Justice League was fighting Superman's jailer, Alpheus , the World Forger. With his new power, Superman incapacitated Alpheus with a single punch but instead of punishing him for his betrayal, he extended an invitation for Alpheus to join the Justice League and an opportunity to save the Multiverse from Perpetua. [ 189 ]
To match Perpetua's army, the Justice League gathered allies from all over the Multiverse and Alpheus suggested they find his brothers, the Monitor and the Anti-Monitor . [ 190 ] Superman partook in the mission to find the Monitor on Nil [ 191 ] but they were unable to find the Anti-Matter on Oward and instead they were forced to escape from an ambush set up by the Legion of Doom. [ 192 ]
The Justice League only had 3 days to stop Perpetua and the Legion of Doom, so Starman formulated a plan to win the oncoming war: to find the missing pieces of the Totality. To that end, the Justice League needed to separate into two teams that would travel to different points in time: the past and the future. Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman would travel to the future and meet Kamandi , the last boy on Earth. [ 193 ] He informed Superman's team that the world had been devastated by Brainiac and brought them to the ruins of the Hall of Justice, where the heroes discovered they were trapped inside one of Brainiac's bottles as part of Brainiac's experiments to find to the Totality. Using one of their old ships, the Justice League travelled to a parallel future, where they were attacked by Brainiac's slaves, the Justice Legion-A . [ 194 ]
Wonder Woman released the Justice Legion from Brainiac's control and, together, they fought as allies against Brainiac [ 195 ] while Kamandi was tasked with protecting the last fragment of the Totality. [ 196 ] Kamandi brought reinforcements in the battle against Brainiac and gave Superman and his friends enough time to return the fragment of the Totality to their homeworld. [ 197 ] Unfortunately, Perpetua had regained her full power and was preparing to reshape the Multiverse to her will. [ 198 ] The Justice League and their remaining allies prepared for one final battle against Perpetua's army. [ 199 ] Superman and his friends personally confronted Lex, who had become Perpetua's most powerful soldier, amidst the ruins of Washington, D.C. [ 200 ] Martian Manhunter attempted to connect with every single person in the Multiverse in order to stop Perpetua and prove that Justice was superior to Doom, but unfortunately, the Multiverse chose Doom over Justice and the Quintessence quickly brought the Justice League to the Moon and informed them that there was still a way to stop Perpetua, but the Justice League would need to travel to the farthest reaches of the cosmos to find it, a mission the Justice League eagerly accepted. [ 201 ]
Death Metal
Unfortunately, the Justice League's mission was a failure and they were forced to return to Earth-0, which was already under attack by an army of Batmen from the Dark Multiverse, led by the Batman Who Laughs . Superman himself was defeated by the Darkfather , imprisoned within the depths of the Sun [ 202 ] and infected with the Anti-Life Equation. With Superman's defeat, Earth-0 fell under the rule of the Batman Who Laughs and the last remaining superheroes went into hiding. [ 203 ]
Infected by Anti-Life.
Superman was later transferred to New Apokolips, where was tortured by the Darkfather until he was rescued by Batman and Wonder Woman. After defeating Darkfather, Superman helped his friends release an army of superheroes imprisoned within New Apokolips and Wonder Woman enlisted them on all on a mission to defeat Perpetua. For that, Superman and his friends needed to travel to the Dark Multiverse and gather enough power to heal the Multiverse. [ 204 ] Superman and his friends infiltrated Castle Bat, home of the Batman Who Laughs, and came across the imprisoned Barbatos, who refused to help the heroes defeat his own treacherous Dark Knight, causing a bored Superman to knock him out. The heroes reached a portal that would take them across different points in the Multiverse's history, each with its own special kind of Crisis energy that could be used to stop the spread of the Dark Multiverse. Superman was sent to the time of the Final Crisis, where he was attacked by Darkseid and a group of Supermen infected by the Anti-Life Equation. [ 205 ]
Darkseid attempted to turn Superman into another one of his slaves, but Superman was rescued by Wonder Woman, who had convinced Superboy-Prime to join the Justice League and stop Perpetua. Unfortunately, once they returned to Earth-0, they discovered the Batman Who Laughs had become the Darkest Knight, a cosmic god as powerful as Perpetua, and created his own Multiverse, the Last 52 Multiverse . [ 206 ] The Darkest Knight summoned Castle Bat to kill Superman and his friends. Although Lex defeated Castle Bat, Superman was reluctant to trust him until Lex made him realize that only together could they stop the Darkest Knight. Lex convinced a group to build a machine powered by Anti-Crisis energy, the only thing capable of healing the Multiverse. The heroes of Earth-0 raised an army to make a final stand against the Darkest Knight and give Wonder Woman enough time to find the materials to build the Anti-Crisis weapon. [ 207 ]
Before the final battle began, however, Superman constructed a time-shifting device that could rewind 60 minutes of time, enough time for Superman to help as many people as he could. The device gave out and Superman returned to the frontlines, but not before spending one last moment of peace with Lois and Jon. [ 208 ] As the Darkest Knight killed Perpetua, Superman and his army prepared to fight the army of the Dark Multiverse, just in time for Wonder Woman, powered by the Anti-Crisis energy, to return to her allies. [ 209 ] Surrounded by the Supermen of the Dark Multiverse, Clark attempted to reason with them and make them see the better part of themselves. His words fell on deaf ears, however, and the Man of Steel was forced to fight, even with his powers severely depleted by Anti-Life. Fortunately, Superman's family and a group of his villains, led by Lex were quick to support him in battle. [ 210 ]
Superman was about to be killed by the Last Sun until Lex sacrificed his life to save him and destroy the Last Sun, while Wonder Woman destroyed the Darkest Knight, healed the Multiverse and resurrected everyone who had died in the conflict. Cured from Anti-Life, Superman returned home and joined his friends in exploring and protecting the Multiverse they had fought so hard to save. [ 211 ]
Infinite Frontier
The Authority and the Warworld Saga
Superman assembles The Authority
In an encounter with aliens from the Breach, Superman was exposed to deadly radiation. [ 212 ] [ 213 ] The resulting radiation sickness caused him to age rapidly and his powers to fade, and so he assembled a team to help protect and improve the world if he were to die or be unable to act as Superman anymore. [ 214 ] He called this team The Authority and enlisted the aid of two members, the Enchantress and Manchester Black , to conceal and slow the progression of his condition. [ 215 ]
The Authority's first mission became clear when an alien craft carrying refugees from Warworld crashed to Earth. The refugees were part of a long-lost group of Kryptonians called the Phaelosians who had been enslaved on Warworld for generations, and Superman swore to free them. [ 216 ] The Phaelosians' ship had also been carrying a powerful energy source known as the Genesis Fragment, which Atlantis laid claim to, heightening tensions with the surface and almost leading to war. Superman confiscated the Fragment and warned both sides against trying to take it, giving the Justice League no choice but to expel him. [ 217 ]
Before Superman left for Warworld, Batman asked him for a favor; he had received visions from a wounded and dying Fuginaut trapped in the Dark Multiverse.  He asked Superman to bring his new team into the Dark Multiverse and attempt to resolve the situation. Superman agreed, and both entered the Dark Multiverse alongside the Authority in order to combat the Empire of Shadows . [ 218 ]
Taken captive by the Mongul-Who-Is
Superman and the Authority journeyed to Warworld, despite warnings that it was almost certainly a trap set by Mongul . Indeed, Mongul was waiting for them and a sorceress working for him reversed the effects of the Enchantress's magic which had been rejuvenating Superman. [ 215 ] Superman was forced to fight in the arenas of Warworld, powerless due to the red solar radiation which saturated the world. He asked a veteran Phaelosian gladiator named Kryl-Ux to teach him how to fight without his powers. [ 219 ] Superman became a more adept fighter and managed to inspire some of his fellow slaves, but he received a message from Midnighter saying that he was planning to destroy the star forges which generated the red solar radiation. This would restore Superman's powers but also kill millions of people. Kryl-Ux told him there may be another way and led him to an isolated part of Warworld's catacombs made of the same material as the Genesis fragment. Superman was able to absorb the cosmic energy of the rock and restore his powers. [ 220 ]
In time, Superman earned a reputation as the "Unbloodied Sword", the warrior that spared his opponents instead of killing them, [ 220 ] and inspire a true rebellion among the slaves of Warworld. He also became a father figure to two young Phaelosian siblings, Osul and Otho-Ra . [ 221 ] Under the advice of Kryl-Ux, Superman embarked on a quest for the fire of Olgrun, a relic of godly power that could end Mongul's reign over Warworld. Although Superman himself had no use for such power, he still chose to search for it, if only to keep Mongul from using it. [ 222 ]
Superman successfully recovered the fire of Olgrun from its resting place, only to find Mongul demanding Superman to surrender the fire, lest Mongul would kill Osul and Otho. [ 223 ] Rather than risk letting the fire fall into Mongul's hands, Superman entrusted the fire to Osul, just in time for the rebels of Warworld to modify Warworld's solar energy generators and switch their radiation from red to white. Superman recovered his powers and was cured from the radiation poisoning he got from the Breach, while Mongul died at the hands of Kryl-Ux, who admitted he had used Superman as a pawn in his own scheme to take revenge on Mongul. Although Kryl-Ux escaped, Superman's mission to liberate Warworld was complete, allowing Superman and his allies to triumphantly return to Earth. [ 224 ]
Dark Crisis
After spending a day of peace with Lois, [ 224 ] Superman returned to active duty by making an impassionate plea to the United Nations to offer safe haven to Warworld's refugees until they could find a new world to settle upon. [ 225 ] He also allowed Osul and Otho to stay over at the Kent apartment and made efforts to protect Osul from Orion, who recognized Osul as the bearer of the fire of Olgrun. [ 226 ] Although Orion was forced to retreat, he promised to find a way to remove the fire from Osul, despite Superman's protests. [ 227 ]
Superman's reunion with the Justice League, however, was cut short [ 228 ] when the League was called upon to fight yet another Multiversal threat, this time in the form of Pariah , an ancient scientist whose universe had been destroyed during the Crisis of Infinite Earths. Pariah had channelled the power of the Great Darkness , a primal force that existed before the birth of the Multiverse, to create a Dark Army composed of enslaved supervillains, including Darkseid and Doomsday, and created a machine that would recreate the worlds destroyed during the Crisis on Infinite Earths, a goal that could destroy Earth-0. Although Superman attempted to reason with Pariah, the renegade scientist refused to back down and activated his machine and the Justice League, Superman included, was caught in its energies. [ 229 ]
Superman absorbs the power of a pocket dimension to fight Pariah
Pariah's machine did not kill Superman, but rather, it placed him in a pocket dimension that represented Superman's deepest desire: the long-lost desire to see Jon's entire life, from childhood to adulthood. Although Superman was initially happy to live in a world in which he could see his son become a man, [ 230 ] he came to realize that this world was not real and dedicated himself towards finding a way to escape. He learned to control the illusion's energies and used this power to return to the real world and fight Pariah once again. [ 231 ]
Superman and his friends joined Earth's remaining superheroes in fighting Pariah's Dark Army, with Clark personally saving Jon from a still-enslaved Doomsday. The Justice League ultimately sealed Pariah in his own fantasy world, but Deathstroke obtained control of the Great Darkness and attempted to destroy the Multiverse. [ 232 ] Black Adam transferred his magical powers to Earth's superheroes, allowing them to defeat the Dark Army, while Doctor Light and the Flash Family purified the Multiverse from the Great Darkness' infection. Although the Dark Crisis had ended, the Justice League was disbanded and its individual members chose to go separate ways. Clark and Jon thanked Black Adam for his help during the crisis, acknowledging that, despite their differences, they were in the same side, at least for now. [ 233 ]
Project Blackout and Supercorp
Soon after the Crisis, Luthor came to the realization that he and Superman should work together. However, he should not be his equal, that Clark should be the outsider alien he always believed him to be. To that end, Luthor initiated Project Blackout , using Henry Bendix's technology, Warworld technology and the psychic powers of Manchester Black to erase the memory of Clark and Jon's identities from the world. Superman would see the aftereffects of this as Perry White, being faced with Superman at the Kent Farm, suffered a heart attack as his mind couldn't handle what was seen. Luthor lured Superman to Lexcorp Tower using a special watch based off of Jimmy Olsen's Signal Watch and revealed what he had done.
Furious, Superman battled Luthor, who ranted that Superman should have told Luthor that he was an outsider like him first and wanted to punish him for telling the world before him. When he revealed that Project Blackout killed Black, Superman became enraged over the death of a man he had given a second chance and willingly took it only for Luthor to snuff it out. Defeating Luthor, he took him to jail for Black's murder.
He later met with Batman and Nightwing and learned that, outside of those within the Kent Farm and its barrier when Project Blackout struck, the Justice League, the Titans and their reservists still knew of Clark and Jon's identity thanks to psychic shields by the Martian Manhunter. Batman convinced him to use this as a second chance, as he believed that he, Lois and Jon lost something when he revealed his identity to the world. [ 234 ]
After Lex's defeat, Clark and Lois announced their plans to formally adopt Osul and Otho into the Superman Family, and the media dubbed the young Phaelosians as the "Super-Twins". The reorganized Superman Family's first mission was the defense of the new Steelworks Tower, an institute founded by John and Natasha Irons as a way to properly research and develop new technologies for the benefit of mankind, from a reconstructed and enhanced Metallo. [ 235 ] Although the Superman Family foiled Metallo's first assault on Steelworks Tower [ 236 ] , Metallo attacked Steelworks again, this time with an army of zombie cyborgs called "Necro-Drones". Metallo ordered his Necro-Drones to self-destruct and injure Supergirl, forcing the Superman Family to help Supergirl while Metallo escaped.
Believing Lex to be responsible for Metallo's rampage, Superman confronted Lex on prison, but Lex claimed no responsibility for Metallo's actions. [ 237 ] Metallo would cause trouble in Metropolis a third time and kidnap the Super-Twins in an attempt to lure Superman into a trap. Fortunately, Superman rescued the Super-Twins and used his Genesis-enhanced powers to defeat Metallo, who claimed that his sister Tracy was in danger and all this time, he had been following the orders of her unseen kidnapper to protect her. Superman agreed to help Metallo save his sister, but nevertheless told him that Metallo would have to pay for all the people he had killed. [ 238 ]
A horde of Necro-Drones attacked A-Town, the apartment complex in Metropolis where the Warworld refugees were housed. While the Superman Family defended A-Town from the Necro-Drones, Superman deduced that Hank Henshaw, the Cyborg Superman, was the real mastermind behind these recent attacks. With the Necro-Drones temporarily defeated, Superman reluctantly activated a copy of the Eradicator to track down Henshaw's latest body to an airport. Superman, his Family and Metallo mounted an assault at Henshaw's base, only to find that Henshaw had transformed Tracy Corben into a cyborg, just like his brother. [ 239 ] The Superman Family deactivated Henshaw's Necro-Drones and Metallo destroyed Henshaw, but Tracy is left badly damaged during the battle, but Superman granted the Corben siblings safe asylum at Steelworks Tower. [ 240 ]
Superman and Lex forced to protect Metropolis together
Shortly before he was arrested, Lex had made Superman the legal owner of LexCorp, which he had renamed "Supercorp" in Superman's honor. Initially, Superman refused to take control of the company formerly owned by his greatest enemy, but Mercy Graves , Lex's assistant, told him that Lex had threatened to dissolve the company and fire his countless employees unless Superman took control. [ 241 ] Superman reluctantly agreed and used Supercorp's resources to protect Metropolis from both the Parasite [ 242 ] [ 243 ] and the Silver Banshee [ 244 ] [ 245 ] who had been both mutated by a mysterious pair of scientists that, according to Lex, had a vendetta against him. Lex explained that, before Superman's arrival, he tried to be a hero and protect the city's downtrodden masses from Pharm and Graft, two scientists who performing unethical experiments on kidnapped victims and they must have been responsible for the mutations of both Parasite and Banshee. [ 244 ] Later, while trying to find Pharm and Graft, Superman stumbled upon a holographic message left by them in the ruins of Metropolis, warning him about something called "Project Chained". [ 245 ]
In his quest to discover what "Project Chained" was, Superman agreed to use Supercorp's resources and ultimately found this project was an experiment in which Lex attempted to build a special prison for superpowered criminals. Only one prison cell was built, located deep beneath Stryker's Island. Superman and Mercy Graves went there and attempted to free its prisoner, Sammy Stryker , only to figure out that Stryker wanted revenge on Lex for imprisoning him in the first place. [ 246 ] Superman escaped from the special prison and intercepted Stryker with help from his family [ 247 ] and Lex explained his old history with the Chained and that they needed to lock him up again. Superman put on a special suit equipped with Kryptonite gauntlets and kept the Chained occupied long enough for Superboy to put him back into his cell. Unfortunately, Superman was severely exposed to the Kryptonite [ 248 ] and had to spend days at Supercorp's medical wing before recovering. Knowing that Pharm and Graft would continue targeting people wronged by Lex, Superman headed back into the field with a special armor, just in time to help Marilyn Moonlight in a fight against Graft, who immediately teleported them into the days of the Wild West. [ 249 ]
Superman in the Wild West
Superman and Marilyn spent days trapped in the Wild West, looking for a way to return home, and confronted Terra-Man, who had equipped they could use to return to present. After defeating Terra-Man and returning home, Superman went to the Supercorp tower to see if his employees were safe, only to be ambushed by Pharm and Graft, who had formed a new Lex Luthor Revenge Squad and wanted Superman to join them. [ 250 ] Graft exposed Superman to red Kryptonite and attempted to make him kill Lex, only for Lex to bring him back to normal by exposing him to green Kryptonite. Unfortunately, Lex's mother, Leticia , had conspired with the Revenge Squad to release a cloud of Kryptonite gas all over Metropolis in an attempt to destroy his son's legacy. [ 251 ] Lex defeated his mother while Superman neutralized the Kryptonite cloud, saving the city, but Superman couldn't help but wonder why did the Revenge Squad wait for this particular moment to restart their vendetta against Lex. [ 252 ]
Blue Earth and Bizarro
A radical humanocentric movement, the Blue Earth , started to gain popularity in Metropolis and its leader, Norah Stone, offered an exclusive interview to the Daily Planet . Clark was put in charge of the interview and, although he deduced that Stone was lying, she was able to frame the Blue Earth's mission as the preservation of humanity. During and after the interview, Clark grew steadily weaker and was attacked by Stone's bodyguard, Dorian, who had somehow drained Clark of his powers. [ 253 ] Luckily, Clark used Lex's old anti-Kryptonians weapons and Dorian's own inexperience with Kryptonian powers to defeat him and discovered that he had used a mysterious green bracelet to regain his powers. Still, Clark's powers would take time to fully recharge, so he asked John Henry to build a special armor for combat. [ 254 ]
With his new armor, Superman easily defeated a gang of Blue Earthers that somehow gained Kryptonian powers and were hurting criminals. Superman's powers were slowly restored, and he deduced that Stone was giving powers to her followers to demonize aliens and strengthen her political stance. He then remembered his old adventure with Batman and the Authority into the Dark Multiverse [ 218 ] and realized that Stone was actually Janan al Ghul , and she had just kidnaped Otho. [ 255 ] To find Otho, Superman asked John Constantine 's help and they invaded Blue Earth's headquarters and liberated Etrigan and Bloodwynd from their prison, and together, they travelled to Earth al Ghul to save Otho and stop Janan. [ 256 ]
Upon their arrival, Superman and his allies attacked the al Ghul's citadel, just as Janan was preparing her invasion of Earth-0. Janan had also brainwashed Otho into attacking her adoptive father, but Superman's love for her daughter allowed her to break free from the brainwashing and Janan was forced to begin her invasion prematurely. Superman and his allies returned home, just in time for the Superman Family and the Blue Earthers to join forces and defend their world together. After a fierce battle, Janan is defeated and Etrigan throws her soul into Hell. [ 257 ] Unfortunately, peace did not last for long, as Bizarro returned to wreak havoc on Metropolis yet again. Bizarro had stolen multiple magical artifacts from across the multiverse and began casting a spell that would have severe consequences on the city and its people. Superman believed Bizarro had lost control of the spell and tried to save him, but Bizarro completed the spell and disappeared in a mystical explosion. Suddenly, everyone in the city began transforming into Bizarros, with the original Bizarro taking control of Superman's mind and body. [ 258 ]
Battle for the soul of Metropolis
Through sheer willpower, Superman fought Bizarro's mental domination and tried to find a way to undo his spell, all the while trying to prevent the citizens of Metropolis from hurting each other. The superhero community isolated Metropolis from the rest of the world and Superman elected to stay behind and help the people in whatever way he could, but despite his best efforts, the quarantine failed, and Bizarro's spell ultimately spread across the world. Superman believed himself to be the only person unaffected by the spell, so he decided to request assistance from the only sane person left on Earth: the Joker. [ 259 ] Using Kryptonian meditation techniques and guidance from the Bizarro Joker, Superman travelled deep into his mind to confront Bizarro, who was still trying to usurp control of Superman's body. After a long mental battle in which Superman died repeatedly, the Man of Steel ultimately gained Bizarro's magical knowledge and used it to undo his spell, even if that meant turning the Joker back into a ruthless murderer. Although the crisis was over, a small piece of Bizarro remained in Superman's mind, but Superman promised to himself to ignore and just be the best version of himself. [ 260 ]
Brainiac and Waller's war on superheroes
Just as Clark and Lois were enjoying a day off, Brainiac would an unleash an army of Czarnians and robots upon Metropolis and orchestrate the kidnapping of every single metahuman in the city, including members of the Superman Family. Superman faced off against the Czarnian general Chacal and demands to be taken to Brainiac, but Lex offered himself in Superman's place, as Brainiac had kidnapped Lex's daughter, Lena, and needed Superman to save their people. After the attack, Superman decided that the only way to find Brainiac would be to find Lobo. [ 261 ] He tracked Lobo down to Coast City and angrily demanded to learn about his connection to Brainiac but Lobo replied that he had no idea what Superman was talking about, until Superman showed him footage of Brainiac's attack and Lobo was surprised to learn that Chacal was involved and decided to help Superman find Chacal, whom Lobo considered a personal idol. The United Planets had established a blockade around the Earth, and to get past it, Supercorp provided Superman and Lobo with spaceworthy motorcycles. Although Superman and Lois successfully bypassed the blockade, they are intercepted by Chacal's forces [ 262 ]
Chacal and his thugs distracted Superman and Lobo enough for Brainiac's ship to escape from Superman's sight, so Lobo took the Man of Steel to Hardcore Stations, a place where they could find information about Brainiac. Unfortunately, Chacal tracked them down and convinced Lobo to betray Superman in exchange for an opportunity to replace him as leader of his gang. [ 263 ] With help from Chacal and his men, Lobo captured Superman and took to Brainiac, who was already waiting for him. Brainiac connected Superman and other metahumans to a special machine that power up his latest creation: a Queen that could absorb the powers of other metahumans. Upon her activation, the Queen was consumed by a destructive appetite that could her to kill Chacal and his men. [ 264 ]
Angry at Brainiac's betrayal, Lobo released Superman, who told his allies to protect Lena, who had been used by Brainiac as a living processor for his ship. Using his tactile telekinesis, Superboy disabled the Queen while Superman and his allies labored to save the cities bottled within Brainiac's ship. Lex came up with a plan to defeat Brainiac but it would involve him and Lena to get inside Brainiac's network and shut it down from within while Superman and his Family fought Brainiac and his forces directly. [ 265 ] Lex and Lena managed to delete Brainiac's entire database but his ship sustained heavy damage during the battle. Brainiac, having lost his entire network and consumed by irrational emotion, begged Superman to save the last city of Colu, which he had preserved before the Omega Titans destroyed the planet. Superman agreed and forcibly separated the Coluan city from Brainiac's ship before it exploded. The survivors from Brainiac's countless attacks settled on an artificial planet called "Colu 2.0" to rebuild their civilization, while Superman and his family returned. Unfortunately, exposure to Brainiac's database had left Lex with amnesia. [ 266 ]
Without his powers, Superman takes a bullet
Superman and his allies would not have time to rest on their laurels, however, as Amanda Waller had unleashed an group of robots, Task Force VII , to steal the powers of every metahuman on Earth. One of those robots, the Last Son , stole the powers of not just Superman, but also those of Conner and Jon. Superman fell victim to Last Son when he was busy stopping a robbery and thus took a bullet to the chest while Last Son kidnapped Jon. [ 267 ] Superman was rushed to the Fortress of Solitude, which had become a makeshift refuge to any victim from Task Force VII, and was subjected to a surgery by Mr. Terrific and Dr. Mid-Nite . Although his life was saved, the number of depowered superhumans was growing and Zatanna, who had been taken to the Fortress by Mercy, suggested a plan that could help them beat Waller, but it involve crossing into the Dark Roads, a realm of magic. [ 268 ]
At the Fortress, Nightwing assumed leadership of the depowered superheroes, while Superman and Batman would outfit their allies with special suits that would replicate their lost powers. Unfortunately, the Fortress would be hit by the Brainiac Queen, reconstructed by Waller to serve her cause. During the battle, Superman would be treated to a terrible sight: Jon had been brainwashed and turned into a slave for Waller. The Man of Steel tried to help his son, but he was ultimately forced to order a retreat and activate the Fortress' self-destruct protocol. Superman was almost captured by the Queen and it was only through Dreamer 's sacrifice that Superman escaped into the Phantom Zone and regroup with his friends. [ 269 ] The world's superheroes set up a new base of operations in Themyscira, while Superman and Zatanna travelled to the Justice League Dark's old headquarters and found a passage to the Parliament of Trees. During their journey, they were attacked by Waller's forces until they found a portal to the Oblivion Bar, where the demon lord Neron was waiting for them. He said he could give them the Map of Mordru, an object that could help them navigate the Dark Roads, but they would have to pay a high price for it. [ 270 ]
Instead of asking for Superman's soul, Neron asked Superman, a living embodiment of truth, to lie, a clear violation of his principles and ideals; and Superman accepted. Zatanna was concerned over Superman's decision, but the Man of Steel believed the importance of their mission was worth the stain on his conscience. With the map, Superman and Zatanna gained access to the Dark Roads but the map started draining Zatanna's life force in the process. Upon reaching the House of Heroes , they found it destroyed and only Dr. Light present. Suddenly, they were attacked by Konfusion , one of the Bureau of Sovereignty 's agents, but Superman and his friends escaped from the Bleed and returned home to reunite with Lois and Mercy, who were waiting for Superman at the ruins of the Fortress. Lois and Mercy decided to return to Metropolis and publish the truth about Waller's actions, while Superman travelled to Themyscira, which had become a temporary base of operations for the superhuamn resistance, to prepare for a final attack on Waller'a base. [ 271 ] The superheroes endured an attack from the Brainiac Queen and released Jon from her control, much to Superman's relief. [ 272 ]
The united heroes began their assault on Waller's base of operations, located deep in Gamorra, and faced heavy opposition from the Bureau of Sovereignty and Task Force VII. Luckily, the tide turned in the heroes' favor when Green Arrow, having revealed himself to be a mole within the Bureau, shot a special device invented by Batman at Waller's robots, causing them to lose their powers and the heroes, Superman included, to regain them. With Task Force VII destroyed and Waller detained, Superman helped Hal Jordan and the Flashes stop a multiversal army of villains from invading their universe, but this was not a clean victory for the heroes. As the Fortress of Solitude underwent extensive reconstructions, Superman, Batman and Wonder Woman reprimanded Green Arrow for his undercover actions, while Green Arrow countered that Waller would not have given them trouble in the first place had the Justice League been there to stop her, a sentiment Superman and his friends agreed with, and so, efforts to rebuild and expand the League began. [ 273 ]
All In
Journey into the Phantom Zone
As the world struggled to recover from Waller's attempt to seize power, Superman and Supergirl were attacked by three Kryptonians from the Phantom Zone that had been forcibly combined into a single, hideous creature. With help from Jimmy and Supergirl, Superman removed the creature's powers with gold Kryptonite and took it to Kandor, where a scientist explained that Kandor had lost its surveillance equipment on the Phantom Zone after the Brainiac Queen had attacked the Fortress. Superman theorized that the Zone was undergoing some kind of change and decided to investigate. He took with him special bracelets that would keep his powers replenished in the sunless Zone and left his family to defend Earth in his absence. [ 274 ] As Superman materialized within the Zone, he was attacked by a band of criminals that still held a grudge against Jor-El for imprisoning them. He quickly captured the criminals and forced them to take him to their boss, until they were ambushed by the Val-Kon, the ship of Xa-Du. When Superman was brought onboard, however, he was surprised to see that it was not Xa-Du who was in charge of the ship, but his old friend Mon-El. [ 275 ]
Brothers reunited
Mon-El, having imprisoned Xa-Du and taken control of his ship in Superman's absence, explained that the Zone was becoming a physical realm thanks to the actions of an entity known as Aethyr, who had promised to release the Zone's prisoners from their eternal torment. Aethyr created physical realms within the Zone and made the Zoners corporeal again. The violent criminals quickly returned to their old ways once they were able to hurt each other, and a disgusted Aethyr enslaved them and appointed Xa-Du as his warden. When the Val-Kon passed an immaterial region in the Zone, Xa-Du took this opportunity to escape and reunite with Aethyr. [ 276 ]
To stop Aethyr, Superman and the Val-Kon's crew travelled to Aethyropolis, the center of Aethyr's power. There, they were attacked by Aethyr's army and Xa-Du destroyed the device Superman was going to use to return to Earth. Superman was ambushed by Aethyr, who was displeased by Xa-Du's failure to control the Phantom Zone and threw both Superman and Xa-Du to the eye of the Phantom Zone, a place in which multiple points of time and space were intertwined. Superman attempted to escape back to Earth by crossing one of the countless cracks in the void, but instead of reaching Earth, he was thrown into Krypton's past. [ 277 ] While exploring the city of Kryptonopolis, Superman deduced that he had travelled back to a time shortly before Krypton's destruction and resolved to find a way home. To do that, he hid his identity under the alias "Klar Ken" and went to the House of El for help in recharging his solar batteries. Jor-El invited Superman to his lab and revealed his theory that Krypton would soon explode, but suddenly, representative from the Science Council called Ro-Zan burst into the lab and arrested Jor-El for developing technology without the Council's permission. Superman attempted to defend his father but was knocked out and arrested, as well. [ 278 ]
After their arrest, Superman, Jor-El and Lara were called to stand trial before the Council for the charge of hoarding special technology for themselves. Because of his lifetime of achievements, the Council has agreed to let Jor-El and his allies walk free, but his latest invention, the Phantom Zone projector, would be left under the Council's custody, much to Jor-El's protests. This development shocked Superman as, all this time, he had believed that his father had proposed the usage of the Phantom Zone as a form of rehabilitation for dangerous criminals. Upon leaving the Council's chambers, Jor-El revealed that he and Lara secretly recovered Superman's solar bracelets. Jor-El took Superman to the home of his brother Zor-El, where they hoped they could repair and recharge the bracelets. [ 279 ]
Zor-El told Superman that he could recharge his solar batteries with his photonic converter, but Ro-Zan has already confiscated it. When a groundquake hit Argo City, Superman told Zor-El that his brother's warnings about Krypton's impending doom might be correct. Zor-El angrily dismissed that theory, for he believed that his brother was disgracing the El name. He threw Superman and the Els out of his house and told them never to come again. With no other options, Superman was forced to sneak into the Science Council's building and try to find Zor's photonic converter so he could recharge his solar bracelets. With his powers fully recharged, Superman returned to the Phantom Zone using the same portal that took him to Krypton in the first place, but upon his arrival, he found that the Zone was starting to collapse. [ 280 ] The Zone was becoming increasingly unstable due to the presence solid matter, and Superman reunited with Mon-El, who revealed that Aethyr had been using Earth's sun as a power source to create solid matter within the Zone. Superman begged Aethyr to stop his plans to reshape the Zone, but Aethyr refused to listen and instead used more solar energy to increase his size until he was crushed under his own mass. All that remained of Aethyr was a sphere he had been using to convert energy into matter and Mon-El used it to create a portal that led Superman back to Earth. [ 281 ]
Superman returned to Earth just in time to save his fellow members of the Super-Family from a fall from orbit after they had exhausted their solar powers in a conflict with the villainous Grax. At the Fortress of Solitude, Mr. Terrific explained that the Sun's decay could be halted if Superman flew deep into the Sun and destroyed the device Aethyr had planted there to convert solar energy into matter within the Phantom Zone. He also warned that destroying the device would likely have catastrophic consequences for the Zone and its prisoners, which is why Superman gave the Phantom Zone projector to Jon and Supergirl and instructed them to travel to a distant planet with a red sun and evacuate the prisoners there. Such plan, however, was met with opposition from Bry-Zan, a high-ranking elected official from Kandor and daughter of Ro-Zan. She warned that releasing prisoners from the Zone without authorization from Kandor would result in Superman's permanent banishment from Kandor, but Superman chose to stick to the plan and save as many as he could. Outfitted with a special armor constructed by his friends, Superman flew into the Sun and successfully destroyed Aethyr's device. Although the Sun was revitalized and Superman's powers were replenished, the Man of Steel was horrified to discover that the Zone's prisoners had escaped and gained powers, as well. [ 282 ]
The Kryptonian criminals severely injured Superman and went on to attack the Earth, while Mon-El rescued Superman and took him to a lead mine in India where he could recover. Superman woke up after two days of rest, and Jimmy and Mon-El informed him about what had happened when he was unconscious. Once he joined the defense of Earth, Superman tried to find his Gold Kryptonite isotope so he could use it to depower the Phantom Zone escapees, only to discover that someone else had taken it. Although the Super-Family and the Justice League successfully apprehended a huge portion of the Zoners, Batman informed Superman that some of the Kryptonians had already spread out into outer space and were attacking foreign planets. [ 283 ] The heroes of Earth mobilized teams across the galaxy to capture the Zoners as quickly as possible, with Superman working alongside Mon-El to defeat Ras-Krom on Grenda. They later went to Braal to intercept Jax-Ur, who revealed that he had stolen the Gold Kryptonite hidden by Superman, but luckily, Mon-El trapped Jax-Ur back in the Zone before he could use it. [ 284 ]
Mon-El's special equipment, which allowed him to interact with the material world, became damaged and he was forced to return to the Zone, leaving Superman and his friends to continue the mission on their own. To capture the Zoners much more quickly, Superman and his friends built a large Phantom Zone projector and set up a trap to lure them into the projector, with Martian Manhunter assuming the form of Xa-Du to attract the escapees into the trap. The plan worked, and the escapees, including Xa-Du, were sent back into the Zone again. Supergirl also convinced the council of Kandor to allow Zoners for the possibility of parole. Mon-El was selected to be the Zone's "warden" and Superman reaffirmed his promise to find a way to cure his friend and release him from the Zone. [ 285 ]
Return of the Justice League and Infection from Red Kryptonite
A new beginning for the Justice League
Superman invited as many heroes as he could to the reformed Justice League and was present at the opening ceremony of the new Watchtower, an event interrupted by a sudden assault from Darkseid, who had absorbed the Spectre to increase his power. Zatanna enchanted Superman with a spell that not only released the Spectre from Darkseid's control, but seemingly destroyed the Dark Lord of Apokolips, as well. Darkseid's apparent death opened a gateway to the mysterious Elseworld, Earth-Alpha, and Superman declared that the new League's first official mission had begun. Booster Gold volunteered to investigate Earth-Alpha, but the League lost contact with him as soon as he stepped into the gateway. [ 286 ] Unfortunately, the new League couldn't spare the time to locate Booster, for it had to answer the threat of the mysterious terrorist organization Inferno, which had unleashed an army of machines to attack a village in South Africa. [ 287 ]
Inferno was ultimately revealed to be composed by members of the Legion of Doom that Gorilla Grodd , empowered by Martian Manhunter's telepathy, had gathered from the past. The younger villains stormed the Watchtower and trapped the heroes in different parts of the timeline [ 288 ] and Grodd absorbed Omega energy released by Darkseid's apparent death to become a godlike entity. [ 289 ] Luckily, the League assembled back in the present, gathered reinforcements from across the timeline and defeated Grodd and the Legion of Doom, but the timeline suffered severe damage during the conflict. [ 290 ]
Although Waller was imprisoned and her forces had been detained, some of the superpowers they had stolen had failed to return to their original owners. Some superhumans had switched powers, while other powers have been spread out across the entire globe and found new owners. [ 273 ] One of those new superhumans was Lois, who had acquired powers similar to those of Superman from General Zod, and she used them to go on many adventures with her husband. Superman and the new Superwoman were ambushed by Doomsday, who had escaped imprisonment from Hell. To make matters worse, Superman was visited by a future Doomsday who had become the latest entity to bear the mantle of the Time Trapper . [ 291 ] The Time Trapper wanted Superman's help to evolve to a newer, more powerful form and stated that everyone Superman knew and loved would be destroyed by an unknown enemy . Superman refused to help the Time Trapper, who simply departed and said that Superman would help him sooner or later. Present Doomsday continued his attack on Metropolis and Supercorp attempted to stop him by having Parasite absorb his power but Doomsday ripped Parasite in half, and Superman was forced to beat Doomsday into unconsciousness so that Supercorp could capture him. [ 292 ]
After Doomsday's capture, Superman took Superwoman on a date, during which they performed a few superhero activities together. He even confessed that the injection of red Kryptonite he got from the Lex Luthor Revenge Squad [ 251 ] was still affecting him. Their date ended with the arrival of the Aftermath, a collective of alien survivors whose planets had been destroyed by Doomsday, above the skies of Metropolis. The Aftermath demanded that Doomsday be handed over to them, lest they would destroy the Earth. [ 293 ] Superman and Superwoman were allowed into the Aftermath's flagship, where they met Aftermath's leader, and tried to negotiate a peaceful solution. The Aftermath's leader, revealed to be the Radiant, continued his threats to destroy the Earth unless Doomsday was handed over, but Superman insisted to learn the purpose behind Doomsday's creation and the Aftermath's purpose for Doomsday once they captured. Enraged that his demands were not met, the Radiant began his attack on Metropolis and tried to steal Doomsday from Supercorp, and Superman, once again at risk from his Red-K infection, was forced to defend Doomsday from the Aftermath's forces. [ 294 ]
During the battle, Superman briefly succumbed to his Red-K infection and nearly killed the Time Trapper before Lois helped him regain control of himself, while Lex trapped Doomsday, the Radiant and his army into a temporally frozen bottle based on Brainiac's technology, but Jimmy was left injured. [ 295 ] Lex and Mercy later informed Superman and Superwoman about the technology developed by Supercorp to be sold in the open market, but Superman was reluctant to do it, fearing it could be used for offensive purposes. [ 296 ] During that period, Lex began to shows signs of recovering memories of his old life [ 297 ] , so Superman called the police to arrest Lex as a precaution. On a mission with the Justice League, Lois discovered that the Khunds had acquired Supercorp weaponry and informed Superman and Lena about it. Together, they confronted Mercy about it and she revealed that she did indeed sell the weapons to the Khunds as part of the original Lex's plan to remake Superman in his image. However, Lex's memory loss delayed that plan. Outraged at Mercy's betrayal, Superman fired her on the spot, but Mercy used Kryptonite against him and revealed her latest creation: a clone of Lex. [ 296 ]
X-El had been created by Lex as a backup plan in case Superman did not accept to take control of Supercorp but was deemed too dangerous to activate. Since he lacked the original Lex's recent memories, X-El attempted to kill Superman and Lois until they were assisted by the original Lex, who powered up his new warsuit to fight his clone. Superman's Red-K levels increased while X-El's body started to deteriorate and Lex had no choice but to kill X-El. Superman was outraged and called Lex out, but he had another thing to worry about: Lois' powers had seemingly vanished. [ 298 ]
Superman took Lois to the Watchtower, where Mr. Terrific conducted tests on her and concluded that her powers had indeed disappeared. Lois accepted the outcome and decided to resume her old life, even though Superman and Mr. Terrific insisted that they could find a way to restore her powers. As Lois returned to the Daily Planet , Superman went to Supercorp and informed Mercy that she was fired and that he would be shutting down Supercorp. Later, he went to visit Lex at Stryker's to ask him if there were any other contingency plans he should be worried about and Lex denied this and told Superman that he could find a way to help Lois be Superwoman again. Suddenly, Superman experienced another Red Kryptonite-induced rage episode and attacked Lex and when prison guards attempted to immobilize Superman, he attacked them, as well. As Lex attempted to escape, Superman briefly regained control of himself and requested help from the Justice League, only to be confroned by Marilyn Moonlight, who said that Metropolis needed to be saved from Superman himself. [ 299 ]
Superman convinced Marilyn to work together in finding Lex, only to find that he had released Pharm and Graft to cover his own escape. Pharm and Graft attacked Metropolis with a giant robot but Superman destroyed it with the symbol of the Supercorp building and then exposed himself to Marilyn's lunar powers, which cured him of his Red-K infection. During the battle, Superman received a message from Lex, who admitted that he got Superman involved with Marilyn, Pharm and Graft as part of his plan to cure Superman and declared his intentions to leave Metropolis for a while. In Lex's absence, Marilyn rebranded Supercorp back into Lexcorp and became its boss, but said that she would still try to help Superman in a way she could. [ 300 ]
Around that time, an inertron asteroid threatened to hit the Earth and Superman moved in to intercept it, only to discover that the asteroid had a secondary Kryptonite layer. Through sheer willpower, Superman slowed the asteroid's descent until it disintegrated in low orbit, but the pain caused him to fall into a coma. He awakened three months later in the Watchtower's medical bay and the Justice League celebrated his recovery, but Batman informed him that, during Superman's coma, humanity had successfully harvested and proliferated the Kryptonite from the asteroid Superman had stopped and Kryptonite had become a readily available energy source to those who could afford it. According to Batman, Superman should have died after getting exposed to so much Kryptonite, but a mysterious golden light covering his body saved him. [ 301 ]
Batman explained that this new power was some kind of evolution of his solar flare ability and that it activated whenever Superman took too much damage from Kryptonite. This solar aura protected Superman from Kryptonite radiation from 200 seconds, but once that time was up, Superman would lose all his powers and still be vulnerable to Kryptonite, which is why Batman advised him to make every second count. Superman initially tried to keep his solar aura a secret but his usage of it became public during a fight with Knockout and her gang. [ 302 ]
Superman went to Smallville to have a meeting with his friends from the Legion of Super-Heroes, but instead, he was ambushed by a Saturn Girl that had been corrupted by Darkseid. She tried to torture Superman with mental images of his friends and loved ones dying, until he was unexpectedly saved by the Time Trapper, who warned Superman that Darkseid's Legion were a threat to all of reality, and to stop them, Superman would need help from an unexpected ally. The Trapper took Superman to a pocket dimension that was the home of Superboy-Prime . [ 303 ] Superman initially did not want help from the murderous Kryptonian who almost destroyed the multiverse, but Prime assured him that he had changed for the better and they needed to work together to stop Darkseid's Legion. The Kryptonians traveled to the 31st century, hoping to get reinforcements from the heroic Legions, only to find that Darkseid's Legion had already decimated them. In the ruins of the Time Institute, Superman rescued Booster Gold, who had gone missing after trying to explore Earth-Alpha [ 286 ] , but he did not recognize him and Booster explained that Darkseid's Legion had captured him and erased Booster from everybody's memories, including Superman. Darkseid's Legion quickly surrounded by Superman and even Prime seemingly betrayed him to join their ranks. [ 304 ]
Powers and Abilities
Powers
Kryptonian Physiology : Superman's Kryptonian biology is able to store solar energy actively within his bio-cellular matrix as an energy pattern that is linked to his body's electromagnetic field. This process powers most of his electromagnetic capabilities such as flight, heat-vision and other "sight"-based abilities, while also supplementing his physical abilities to immense superhuman levels. [ 60 ] Aside from his incredible power, Superman is integral to the balance of the universe. The Spectre explained that Superman embodies the primal forces of Life and Hope, which push reality outwards to expand. This force is counterbalanced by Constraint, which holds the expansion back, and is embodied by Darkseid . Together, they maintain the balance of the universe. [ 286 ] Solar Radiation Absorption : Due to his Kryptonian biology, Superman's body absorbs solar energy and converts it into power, causing him to pull in 140 gigawatts of solar energy at any given moment. [ 305 ] . Stars of different frequencies give him different abilities. Earth's yellow sun fuels all of his powers, while the wavelength of his home solar system's Red Sun enables his body to function on an identical level of an ordinary human. Every time Superman uses any of his superhuman abilities, his body expends absorbed sunlight. By flying into the sun, Superman is able to recharge his energy and temporarily boost his powers. Radiation Absorption : Superman's solar receptors have allowed him to absorb different types of radiation in certain instances. He has absorbed cosmic energy from Starman , gained from the Totality itself. [ 306 ] This boosted his powers to the point that he felt like he could crack the Earth in half with a footstep, if he wasn't careful. [ 307 ] Superman also displayed the ability to absorb the radiation from an atomic explosion, however this left him severely weak. [ 308 ] Superhuman Strength : Superman possesses near limitless strength, though the exact limits of Superman's strength is unknown. Superman is one of the most physically strongest beings in the multiverse. His immense willpower allows him to push beyond his physical limits when necessary, allowing Superman to exert incredible feats of strength. Brainiac has stated that Superman has the most amount of power in the universe. [ 261 ] He was strong enough to knock out a restrained Barbatos, [ 141 ] with a just a punch. [ 309 ] When Superman fought against Rogol Zaar inside the Phantom Zone , their fight made the realm tremble and shake, under the weight of their battle. [ 310 ] After being supercharged by multiple suns, Superman was able to punch the World Forger hard enough to create a continent-sized hole, and crack a tear in the Sixth Dimension . [ 189 ] Shock Wave Projection : Superman is strong enough to create powerful sonic booms with just the clap of his hands. These sonic claps are powerful enough to be heard across states. [ 311 ] Superhuman Speed : Superman is able to move at incredible speed by sheer force of will. This extends to his perceptions and allows for feats such as catching bullets in mid flight as well as covering vast distances in little or no time. Superman was even fast enough to keep up with Wally West on foot, though he is still not as fast. [ 312 ] He can move so fast that time slows from his perspective, long enough to have an entire conversation in just a few seconds. [ 313 ] Superman is fast enough to essentially be in two places at once, as he was capable of fighting Darkseid and saving the lives of others simultaneously, which perplexed even Darkseid himself. [ 314 ] After being supercharged by multiple suns, Superman was able to move at a speed described as beyond physics and imagination, and far past the speed of light. [ 189 ] After being powered by a White Sun on Warworld , Superman becomes fast enough that he can cross through space-time to travel across several light years in a matter of seconds. [ 315 ] Time Travel : Superman is fast enough to use the Cosmic Treadmill to travel through the timestream , which requires speeds great enough to break the time-barrier. [ 133 ] Under the right conditions, Superman states that he can use his speed to travel through the timestream unaided. [ 316 ] Molecular Acceleration : Superman can vibrate his molecular structure to achieve various effects. [ 317 ] By vibrating fast enough, Superman can enter the "space between spaces", a vibrational frequency that nobody can perceive, thus giving him and General Zod the chance to talk privately. [ 318 ] Phasing : By vibrating his molecules on an atomic level, and by doing so at just the right frequency, Superman can phase through objects such as walls without damaging them. [ 237 ] Intangibility : Superman can vibrate his molecular structure to an intangible state, allowing objects to pass through him, including energy blasts. [ 319 ] Vortex Creations : Superman can use his speed to manipulate airflow for various purposes. He was able to use his flight speed to funnel a toxic chemical out of the atmosphere and into space. [ 131 ] By flying around a group of enemies at super speed, Superman can create a vortex around them to draw away their oxygen and choke them out. [ 320 ] Superhuman Agility : Superman's agility, balance, and bodily coordination are enhanced to superhuman levels. This allows him to easily make sharp turns and easily maneuver while flying and moving at superhuman speed. Superhuman Reflexes : Superman possesses reflexes far greater than any normal human being. This allows him to easily react to danger and events, and perceive the world in slow motion. [ 148 ] Superhuman Stamina : Superman is able to maintain continuous strenuous physical action for an indefinite period of time. This is based on his body converting yellow solar radiation directly to energy but is limited by physiological and psychological needs to eat, drink and sleep. Superhuman Senses : All of Superman's senses are enhanced to superhuman levels, allowing him to perceive the world in far greater detail than the average human. [ 148 ] By combining his super-hearing with the sound waves from his sonic-claps, he can simulate a rough form of echolocation. [ 321 ] Super-Vision : Superman's vision processes the entire electromagnetic spectrum as well as allowing vast control over selective perception and focus. This umbrella ability includes the following: Electromagnetic Spectrum Vision : Superman can see well into most of the electromagnetic spectrum. He can see and identify radio and television signals as well as all other broadcast or transmitted frequencies. Using this ability, he can avoid detection by radar or satellite monitoring methods. This also allows him to see the aura generated by living things. Infrared Vision : Superman can see with better acuity in darkness, and to a degree in total darkness. Microscopic Vision : This is the ability to see extremely small objects and images down to the atomic level. Radiation Production : Superman can emit various forms of radiation through his eyes. He once used this ability to emit microwave radiation to fry the electronics in a room. [ 25 ] Telescopic Vision : This is the ability to see something at a great distance, without violating the laws of physics. Though limited, the exact extent of the ability is undetermined. In function, it is similar to the zoom lens on a camera. X-Ray Vision : By focusing his vision, Superman can see through any volume of matter, except lead. He can see things behind a solid, opaque object as if it were not there and can focus this ability to "peel back" layers of an object, allowing hidden image or inner workings to be observed. Superman's enemies have attempted to use lead to hide things from his vision, mistakenly believing that anything with that material is somehow invisible to him. On the contrary, lead's opaqueness to his X-ray vision makes the material easy to spot with a wide-angle scan and allows Superman to narrow his search to those opaque objects. [ 322 ] He can even use intensify his X-Ray vision to the extent that he could use it at a Gamma level to short out a Space Station's electrical engine. [ 323 ] Super-Hearing : Superman's hearing is sensitive enough to hear any sound at any volume or pitch. With skill and concentration, he can block out ambient sounds to focus on a specific source or frequency. Superhuman Taste : Superman's sense of taste is enhanced to levels far greater than any normal human. He is capable of singling out every specific ingredient in food by tasting it. [ 324 ] Accelerated Healing : Superman's bodily tissue can repair itself fast enough to be visibly noticeable, allowing him to heal from injuries at a highly accelerated rate. [ 25 ] The time it takes for him to heal depends on the level of injury. When under direct sunlight, Superman can heal almost instantly. [ 25 ] Toxic Immunity : Superman is resistant to any toxins and diseases due to his superhuman immune system. [ 325 ] Enhanced Mental Process : Superman's mental capacity is enhanced to levels far greater than any normal human, allowing him to take in and process information at an accelerated rate. This allows Superman to read through large amounts of information at super-speed and retain it. [ 54 ] [ 326 ] His mind is able to process information at such speeds that he can perceive femtoseconds and attoseconds. [ 148 ] Flight : Superman is able to manipulate graviton particles to defy the forces of gravity and achieve flight. This ranges from hovering to moving in any posture, in any direction. He is capable of flying at above supersonic and hypersonic speeds. [ 148 ] Heat Vision : Superman can fire beams of intense heat at a target by looking at it. He can vary the heat and area affected. After receiving brief training from Wraith on how to use his heat vision for more combative purposes, Superman learned to rapid fire his heat vision at maximum heat, by blinking at super speed. [ 327 ] Solar Flare : Superman's last resort power that he'd discovered through his heat vision, was the ability to immediately expel all of his stored solar energy in one gigantic burst of explosive force. This Solar Flare uses all the stored energy within his cells at once, allowing for an all-out attack. [ 98 ] He cannot use it more than once or twice however, as it drains him of all his powers until he can recharge his cells with solar energy. Give or take 24 hours, in that expanse of time, he is rendered virtually human and vulnerable. [ 328 ] [ 329 ] [ 324 ] Superman eventually learned to keep his flares smaller and more contained, so that it doesn't take a toll on his powers. [ 99 ] Cyborg stated that this Solar Flare has the effects of an EMP. [ 330 ] Immortality : Superman is unable to die from old-age and will seemingly live forever. Neron has stated that Superman will never die forever, [ 271 ] and Time Trapper will be the only entity in all of creation that lives to the end of time alongside Superman. [ 331 ] Interstellar Travel : Superman is immune to the nature of space and is not inhibited by its lack of gravity. He can travel the reaches of space where no human body could possibly survive without the aid of technology or protection. [ 148 ] Invulnerability : Due to the interaction of his dense molecular structure and supercharged bio-electric aura, Superman is nigh-invulnerable to nearly all physical attacks, including bullets, blades, blunt objects, and explosions. Only beings rivaling his own power, Kryptonite-based weaponry, and magic-based attacks can significantly harm Superman. Energy Resistance : Superman is highly resistant to most energy-based attacks. On separate occasions he has withstood 300,000 volts and 10 gigawatts of electricity running through him. [ 25 ] [ 326 ] He was even able to deflect Darkseid's full-power Omega-Beams off his chest, and was completely unharmed. [ 286 ] Super Shell : After an encounter with an Inertron enlaced kryptonite meteor in Earth's outer orbit, Clark developed a new superpower similar in function to his Super Flare. [ 332 ] Where he temporarily gleams with a bright golden energy that temporarily guards him from harmful K radiation dependent upon his remaining solar energy reserves. [ 333 ] Once it burns through his sun charged metabolics, Kal-El will be rendered powerless until he can fully recharge again. Super-Breath : Superman is able to create hurricane force winds by exhaling air from his lungs. He can also chill the air as it leaves his lungs to freeze targets. [ 334 ] He can also reverse the process to pull large volumes of air or vapor into his lungs. Self-Sustenance : Superman doesn't need to eat or sleep so long as he has enough solar energy (but is still capable of doing so) and doesn't require oxygen to breathe. [ 335 ]

[ 99 ] Cyborg stated that this Solar Flare has the effects of an EMP. [ 330 ]
Solar Flare : Superman's last resort power that he'd discovered through his heat vision, was the ability to immediately expel all of his stored solar energy in one gigantic burst of explosive force. This Solar Flare uses all the stored energy within his cells at once, allowing for an all-out attack. [ 98 ] He cannot use it more than once or twice however, as it drains him of all his powers until he can recharge his cells with solar energy. Give or take 24 hours, in that expanse of time, he is rendered virtually human and vulnerable. [ 328 ] [ 329 ] [ 324 ] Superman eventually learned to keep his flares smaller and more contained, so that it doesn't take a toll on his powers. [ 99 ] Cyborg stated that this Solar Flare has the effects of an EMP. [ 330 ]
Immortality : Superman is unable to die from old-age and will seemingly live forever. Neron has stated that Superman will never die forever, [ 271 ] and Time Trapper will be the only entity in all of creation that lives to the end of time alongside Superman. [ 331 ]
Interstellar Travel : Superman is immune to the nature of space and is not inhibited by its lack of gravity. He can travel the reaches of space where no human body could possibly survive without the aid of technology or protection. [ 148 ]
Invulnerability : Due to the interaction of his dense molecular structure and supercharged bio-electric aura, Superman is nigh-invulnerable to nearly all physical attacks, including bullets, blades, blunt objects, and explosions. Only beings rivaling his own power, Kryptonite-based weaponry, and magic-based attacks can significantly harm Superman. Energy Resistance : Superman is highly resistant to most energy-based attacks. On separate occasions he has withstood 300,000 volts and 10 gigawatts of electricity running through him. [ 25 ] [ 326 ] He was even able to deflect Darkseid's full-power Omega-Beams off his chest, and was completely unharmed. [ 286 ] Super Shell : After an encounter with an Inertron enlaced kryptonite meteor in Earth's outer orbit, Clark developed a new superpower similar in function to his Super Flare. [ 332 ] Where he temporarily gleams with a bright golden energy that temporarily guards him from harmful K radiation dependent upon his remaining solar energy reserves. [ 333 ] Once it burns through his sun charged metabolics, Kal-El will be rendered powerless until he can fully recharge again.

[ 333 ] Once it burns through his sun charged metabolics, Kal-El will be rendered powerless until he can fully recharge again.
Super-Breath : Superman is able to create hurricane force winds by exhaling air from his lungs. He can also chill the air as it leaves his lungs to freeze targets. [ 334 ] He can also reverse the process to pull large volumes of air or vapor into his lungs.
Self-Sustenance : Superman doesn't need to eat or sleep so long as he has enough solar energy (but is still capable of doing so) and doesn't require oxygen to breathe. [ 335 ]
White Sun Enhancement : After being exposed to Warworld 's Genesis -powered "White" Sun, Superman's existing powers were greatly enhanced and granted new abilities, making him strong enough to fight two New Gods simultaneously. [ 319 ] . After the White Sun exposure, Superman claimed that concepts like weight, distance, temperature and even space-time have largely lost their meaning for him. [ 234 ] Tactile Telekinesis : After White Sun exposure, Superman learned to extend his bio-electric aura to freeze Lex Luthor's Warsuit with a thought and cause it to break apart with a touch. [ 234 ] Teleportation : After White Sun exposure, Superman gained the ability to instantaneously travel across interstellar distances by creating rifts in space-time. When teleported away by Lex Luthor, Superman was able to quickly travel back to Lex though a rift in space. [ 234 ]
Tactile Telekinesis : After White Sun exposure, Superman learned to extend his bio-electric aura to freeze Lex Luthor's Warsuit with a thought and cause it to break apart with a touch. [ 234 ]
Teleportation : After White Sun exposure, Superman gained the ability to instantaneously travel across interstellar distances by creating rifts in space-time. When teleported away by Lex Luthor, Superman was able to quickly travel back to Lex though a rift in space. [ 234 ]
Genesis Enhancement : When exposed to the powerful, radioactive mineral called Genesis , Superman's powers are temporarily enhanced, allowing him to perform new abilities. Genesis is the crystalized blood of an Old God , making it highly mutagenetic. Due to this, Superman cannot absorb large amounts of the energy, unless the mutative radiation is filtered out. [ 238 ] Energy Construct Creation : When supercharged by Genesis, Superman can expand his bio-electric aura to surround himself in a giant energy construct of himself. [ 238 ] Kryptonite Immunity : When supercharged by Genesis, Superman can greatly resist the effects of Kryptonite. [ 238 ]

Altered Physiology : Due to Savage altering his cellular matrix through foreign radiation, Kal-El was rendered incapable of properly processing yellow sunlight halving his abilities. [ 101 ] Eventually it was discovered that due to the way his genes mutated, he could then be empowered through Kryptonite to burn off his poisoned biophysical essence and simulate his old powers. Kryptonite Radiation Absorption : Superman's Kryptonite charged cells could simulate his old powers but with differences and lethal side effects, using Kryptonite as chemotherapy was killing off his healthy cells as well as the deviant with prolonged exposure. Parallax Unison : For a brief amount of time, Clark was fused to the fear entity known as Parallax. With it he had all the power of the yellow entity combined with those of his own, making Superman that much stronger than before. [ 337 ]
Abilities
Genius Level Intellect : Superman has shown incredible intelligence and computational abilities; his mind works sharply and with extreme speed relative to earth-humans. Superman's analytical powers enable him to read information directly from machines With careful usage of his heat vision, he can even reprogram machines. [ citation needed ]
Hand-to-Hand Combat (Advanced) : Superman is an excellent hand-to-hand fighter, utilizing a fighting style that directly complements his superpowers. Superman's combat versatility allows him to adapt to almost any foe and beat them. He was trained by Wioska, a former combat instructor of Apokolips , [ 338 ] Wonder Woman in Amazonian combat, [ 339 ] [ 340 ] and was taught by Kryl-Ux how to fight like a Warworld gladiator [ 341 ] . He even learned some advanced martial arts techniques from Batman. [ 342 ] [ 60 ] [ 343 ] Batman even stated that Clark can take care of himself, even without powers. [ 344 ] In weakened state, Kal got the upper hand on both Cyborg Superman and the Eradicator , while suffering from blindness. [ 345 ] Superman has shown capable of fighting blind while weakened on multiple occasions. [ 346 ] [ 347 ] He has fought the likes of Black Adam to a stalemate. [ 348 ] He has impressed the likes of Captain Comet , [ 349 ] Batman , [ 350 ] [ 351 ] Wonder Woman , [ 352 ] Moon , [ 353 ] Pax Galactica , [ 354 ] General Zod , [ 355 ] Grikus the Undefeated, [ 356 ] the Tournament Judge of Warworld, [ 357 ] Wioska, [ 358 ] and Desaad . [ 359 ] Boxing : Superman has been trained his father Johathan Kent in boxing. [ 360 ] [ 361 ] Jiu-Jitsu [ 60 ] Wrestling [ 362 ]
Boxing : Superman has been trained his father Johathan Kent in boxing. [ 360 ] [ 361 ]
Jiu-Jitsu [ 60 ]
Wrestling [ 362 ]
Indomitable Will : Superman has shown to have a powerful spirit, free of corruption and temptation. Having been raised by a kindly Kansas farmer and his wife, he was taught to protect life and help others. He is very optimistic and never gives up, even when things look bad. Superman has learned how to place mental inhibitors on his own power so that he doesn't accidentally "flex and cause the tectonic plates to shift." To him, they are the barriers that allow him to feel human enough to live a healthy life, and he only ever releases one of them when fighting a particularly powerful opponent or performing a difficult task.
Intimidation
Investigation : Both as a superhero and as a journalist, Superman is an expert at gathering evidence from all kinds of sources. [ 363 ]
Journalism : Clark is one of the best reporters on the Daily Planet , rivaled only by his wife Lois Lane. He gained a Pulitzer Prize at least in one occasion.
Leadership : Superman has proven many times over his ability to command respect and inspire others with his charisma, ardor and idealism. He often serves as the primus inter pares of the Justice League.

Weaknesses
Kryptonian Physiology : Under the effects of a "yellow" sun, Superman possesses the same potential weaknesses as an average Kryptonian. These include: Vulnerability to Kryptonite Vulnerability to Magic
Vulnerability to Kryptonite
Vulnerability to Magic
Solar Energy Dependency : Kryptonian abilities will eventually weaken without replenishing their energy reserves with normal (yellow) sun radiation. When exposed to the same red solar radiation as Krypton's red sun Rao, it causes Kryptonians to lose their powers within a large amount of exposure until exposure to yellow sunlight reverses this effect. When exposed to orange solar radiation from a different galaxy, Superman's strength and abilities will drastically diminished, eventually weakening him. The radiation also affects his intellectual capacity and reduces his ability to think. [ 376 ]
Sensory Overload : Superman's superhumanly acute senses can be overtaxed to the point of pain when encountered by extreme external stimuli such as hypersonics (hearing), balance, and sight (flashbang).
Radiation Poisoning : (Formerly) Superman was exposed to deadly radiation during his encounter with the aliens from the Breach, causing him to rapidly age. He slowed the progression of his condition via regular infusions of rejuvanating magic from The Enchantress , but this was undone by a sorceress working for Mongul. [ 215 ] He was eventually cured by Genesis. [ 377 ] Power Limitation : (Formerly) Superman's sickness caused his powers to fade and weaken. While still significantly stronger than a human, he was less powerful than an average healthy Kryptonian until his radiation poisoning was cured. [ 378 ]
Power Limitation : (Formerly) Superman's sickness caused his powers to fade and weaken. While still significantly stronger than a human, he was less powerful than an average healthy Kryptonian until his radiation poisoning was cured. [ 378 ]
Other Characteristics
Emotional Instability : (Formerly) Superman was exposed to synthetic Red Kryptonite , which unlike genuine Red Kryptonite did not wear off after twenty-four hours. As a result of the Kryptonite, Superman became prone to violent rages when overstressed. In this state he lost all self-control and could potentially kill someone. [ 379 ] [ 380 ] [ 381 ] He was eventually cured by Marilyn Moonlight's powers. [ 382 ]
Paraphernalia
Weapons
Yellow Lantern Ring (Formerly) : While a part of the Sinestro Corps, Superman earned a ring for his ability to inspire great fear in others. [ 383 ]
Notes
Superman was created by Jerry Siegel and Joe Shuster , first appearing  in Action Comics #1 . However, Superman first appeared as part of Prime Earth continuity in Flashpoint (Volume 2) #5 by Geoff Johns and Andy Kubert .
Doctor Manhattan discovered that Superman is a pivotal constant in the universe. Despite changes to timeline, the Metaverse consistently preserves Superman's existence and core history by expanding itself, creating new realities to preserve every era of Superman, emphasizing his role as a source of hope that anchors reality and inspiring heroism across all realities. [ 19 ]
Trivia
Kal-El literally translates to " Star Child " from Kryptonese . [ citation needed ]
Clark considers Bruce Wayne to be his best friend. [ 20 ] He also believes that Batman is a better man than him. [ 384 ] Batman himself considers Superman to be his favorite superhero. [ 385 ]
Clark is at least 36 years old. [ 386 ]
Superman has been an active crime-fighter for at least two decades. [ 387 ] [ 18 ]
Clark is a fan of Clint Eastwood . [ 388 ]
Clark considers Dick Grayson to be his favorite Robin. [ 389 ]
Clark crash-landed on Earth on June 18. He celebrates this day as his birthday since that was the day his parents found him as an infant. [ 13 ]
Khalid Nassour served as Superman's therapist for a time after outing his secret identity. [ 390 ] [ 391 ]
As a teenager, Clark briefly had a crush on Saturn Girl of the Legion of Super-Heroes, when he was a member under the name of Superboy. [ 392 ]
Every Sunday in Smalville, Clark and his Father used to sit on the couch and watch a classic Western together. [ 250 ]
